若因劳倦而素易呕泻，多有脾不摄血，而为吐血下血者，宜六味回阳饮大加白朮主之，万不可用凉药。若大吐大衄，而六脉细脱，手足厥冷，危在顷刻，而血犹不止者，速宜用镇阴煎，其血自止。若血脱至甚，气亦随之，因至厥逆昏愦者，速当益气以固生机，宜六味回阳饮，或四味回阳饮主之。若再用寒凉即死。总之失血吐血，必其阴分大伤，使非加意元气，培养真阴，而或专用寒凉，则其阴气愈损，血虽得止，而病必日败矣。　　虚损伤阴，本由于五脏。虽五脏各有所主，然五脏证治，有可分者，有不可分者。[160p]

If vomiting and diarrhea easily occur due to fatigue, it is often because the spleen fails to manage blood, resulting in vomiting or bleeding. One should use the Six-Flavor Reverting Yang Decoction with an increased amount of white atractylodes as the main remedy, and it is crucial to avoid cool medicines.

If there is significant vomiting and bleeding, with weak and thin pulse, cold hands and feet, and a critical state imminent, while the bleeding still does not stop, it is essential to quickly use the Zhen Yin Decoction, which will stop the bleeding on its own. If the bleeding is severe and the qi also follows suit, resulting in coldness and fainting, one must promptly replenish qi to stabilize life force. The Six-Flavor Reverting Yang Decoction or the Four-Flavor Reverting Yang Decoction should be used. If cold or cool substances are used again, it would be fatal.

In summary, bleeding and vomiting manifest from significant damage to the yin aspect, which demands careful attention to nourishing the original qi and cultivating true yin. Otherwise, the use of cold and cool substances will further deplete the yin qi, and although the bleeding may stop, the condition will inevitably worsen day by day.

Yin deficiency and damage arise from the five organs. Although each organ has its own dominion, there are aspects of diagnosis and treatment in the five organs that can be distinguished, as well as those that cannot.[160p]

如诸气之损，其治在肺；神明之损，其治在心；饮食肌肉之损，其治在脾；诸血筋膜之损，其治在肝；精髓之损，其治在肾。此其可分者也。然气主于肺而化于精，神主于心而化于气，肌肉主于脾而土生于火，诸血藏于肝而血化于脾胃，精髓主于肾，而受之于五脏，此其不可分者也。及乎既甚，则标本相传，连及脏腑，此又方之不可执言也。故凡补虚之法，但当明其阴阳升降，寒热温凉之性；精中有气，气中有精之因。且凡上焦阳气不足者，必下陷于肾也，当取之至阴之下；下焦真阴不足者，多飞越于上也，可不引之归源乎？所以治必求本，方为尽善。然余用补之法，则悉在新方八略八阵中，惟细察之，可得其概。其有诸证未备者，如遗精梦泄，声哑盗汗，及妇人血枯经断等证，但于各门求之，则无不俱有照应。[161p]

In cases of qi deficiency, the treatment lies in the lungs; for spirit deficiency, it is in the heart; for deficiency in food and muscle, it is in the spleen; for blood and membrane deficiency, it is in the liver; and for essence and marrow deficiency, it is in the kidneys. These are the distinctions that can be made. However, qi governs the lungs and transforms through essence, the spirit governs the heart and transforms through qi, muscle comes under the spleen and the earth is born from fire, all blood is stored in the liver and blood transforms in the spleen and stomach, essence and marrow govern the kidneys and receive from the five organs, which are inseparable. When the state becomes severe, the root and branch are transmitted and affect the organs and viscera, thus this aspect cannot be strictly defined. Therefore, in all methods of replenishing deficiency, one must clarify the principles of yin and yang, their ascents and descents, and the nature of cold, heat, warmth, and coolness; with essence being within qi and qi being within essence. Furthermore, in cases of insufficient yang qi in the upper jiao, it must descend into the kidneys; thus, it ought to be sought below the most yin; and when there is insufficient true yin in the lower jiao, it often rises above—should we not guide it back to its source? Therefore, the treatment must seek the root to achieve the utmost goodness. However, my other methods of supplementation are all found within the new formulas of the eight guidelines and eight arrays; with careful observation, one can grasp their essence. For symptoms not fully manifest, such as nocturnal emission, dream leakage, hoarse voice, night sweats, and women's blood depletion or menstrual cessation, one should just inquire in each relevant domain, and there will be corresponding guidance available.[161p]

　　　　　辨似损非损

　　凡似损非损之证，惟外感寒邪者乃有之。盖以外邪初感，不为解散，而误作内伤，或用清凉，或用消导，以致寒邪郁伏，久留不散，而为寒热往来，或为潮热咳嗽，其证则全似劳损，若用治损之法以治此证，则滋阴等剂，愈以留邪，热蒸既久，非损成损矣。余尝治愈数人，皆其证也。欲辨此者，但当详察表里，而审其致病之由。盖虚损之证，必有所因；而外感之邪，其来则骤。若或身有疼痛，而微汗则热退，无汗则复热，或见大声咳嗽，脉虽弦紧而不甚数，或兼和缓等证，则虽病至一两月，而邪有不解，病终不退者，本非劳损，毋误治也。若寒热往来不止者，宜一、二、三、四、五柴胡饮酌宜用之，或正柴胡饮亦可。若兼咳嗽者，柴陈煎。若脾肾气虚而兼咳嗽者，金水六君煎。或邪有未解而兼寒热者，仍加柴胡。[162p]

Distinguishing Between Apparent Damage and Non-Damage

In cases where there appear to be damages but are not, this phenomenon is only present when the body has been subjected to external cold pathogens. Initially, when these external pathogens invade, they do not disperse and are mistakenly treated as internal injuries; treatments may involve cooling or drainage methods, which can lead to the cold pathogens becoming trapped and lingering, resulting in alternating chills and fever or phlegmy cough. The symptoms may seem identical to those of exhaustion. If one treats this condition with methods aimed at injuries, such as nourishing yin, this can actually exacerbate the retention of the pathogens, leading to prolonged heat effects, ultimately transforming what is not an injury into an actual injury. I have treated several patients with this condition. To distinguish such cases, one must carefully analyze both the exterior and the interior and investigate the causes of the illness. Symptoms indicative of exhaustion always stem from some cause, whereas external pathogen invasion occurs suddenly. If there is bodily pain accompanied by slight sweating, resulting in diminished fever, yet fever returns without sweating, or if there is a loud cough with a pulse that feels taut but not overly rapid, or a mix of harmonious and relaxed symptoms, then even if the illness lasts for a month or two without resolution of the pathogens, this is not a case of labor injury—do not misdiagnose. For those with persistent alternating fever and chills, it is advisable to use the Chai Hu Decoction (or variants thereof). If cough accompanies it, then add Chai Chen Decoction. For those with spleen and kidney qi deficiency accompanied by cough, use Jin Shui Liu Jun Decoction. If the pathogens are still unresolved and accompanied by chills and fevers, continue adding Chai Hu.[162p]

　　　　　虚损危候

　　凡虚损既成，不补将何以复？而有不能服人参、熟地及诸补之药者，此为虚不受补，何以望生？若劳损吐血失血之后，嗽不能止而痰多甚者，此以脾肺虚极，饮食无能化血，而随食成痰，此虽非血，而实血之类也。经曰：白血出者死。故凡痰之最多最浊者，不可治。左右者，阴阳之道路。其有不得左右眠而认边难转者，此其阴阳之气，有所偏竭而然，多不可治。　　凡病虚损者，原无外邪，所以病虽至困，终不愦乱。其有患虚证，别无邪热，而谵妄失伦者，此心脏之败，神去之兆也，必死。　　劳嗽喑哑，声不能出，或喘急气促者，此肺脏之败也，必死。　　劳损，肌肉脱尽者，此脾脏之败也，必死。　　筋为疲极之本，凡病虚损者，多有筋骨疼痛，若痛有至极不可忍者，乃血竭不能荣筋，此肝脏之败也，必死　　劳损既久，再及大便泄泻不能禁止者，此肾脏之败也，必死。[163p]

Deficiency and Its Dire Consequences

When deficiency has already taken hold, how can one remedy it? If one cannot tolerate ginseng, cooked rhizoma rehmanniae, and various tonifying medicines, this indicates an inability to receive nourishment due to deficiency—how can one hope for recovery? If, after exhausting labor, one experiences vomiting of blood or significant blood loss, and suffers from coughing that cannot be stopped along with excessive phlegm, this is due to extreme deficiency of the spleen and lungs, rendering food unable to transform into blood, thus phlegm is formed from food consumed. Although this is not blood, it is similar in nature. The classics say: "If white blood emerges, death follows." Hence, the phlegm that is the most abundant and turbid cannot be treated.

On either side of the body is the pathway of yin and yang. For those who cannot turn or change their position easily during sleep, it indicates an imbalance in yin and yang energies, leaving them deplete—this too is often untreatable. In cases of deficiency illness, there is generally no external pathogen, so although the disease may be exhausting, it does not cause chaos. If one has a deficiency syndrome, without any other pathogenic heat, and experiences delirium and disarray, this indicates heart failure and the departure of spirit—it is certainly fatal.

If labor causes coughing, loss of voice, or acute wheezing and shortness of breath, this signifies lung failure—it is certainly fatal. In cases of extreme labor where all muscle is exhausted, this indicates spleen failure—it is certainly fatal.

Tendons are the root of fatigue; in any case of deficiency and chronic illness, there are often pains in the muscles and bones. If the pain becomes unbearably severe, this indicates depletion of blood unable to nourish the tendons—this is liver failure—it is certainly fatal.

When exhaustion has persisted for a long time, and one suffers from uncontrollable diarrhea, this indicates kidney failure—it is certainly fatal.[163p]

　　　　　论难经损证

　　按《难经》上损下损之说，其义极精，然有未尽者，犹宜悉也。盖凡思虑劳倦外感等证则伤阳，伤于阳者，病必自上而下也；色欲醉饱内伤等证则伤阴，伤于阴者，病必自下而上也。如经曰：二阳之病发心脾，有不得隐曲，女子不月之类，此即自上而下者也。又经曰：五脏主藏精者也，不可伤，伤则失守而阴虚，阴虚则无气，无气则死矣。此即自下而上者也。盖自上而下者，先伤乎气。[164p]

Discussion on the Difficult Classic of Damage and Evidence

According to the "Difficult Classic," the concepts of upper damage and lower damage are extremely profound, yet there are aspects that remain incomplete and should be thoroughly understood. Generally speaking, external factors such as overthinking and fatigue damage Yang; when Yang is harmed, the illness necessarily arises from above and descends. Conversely, internal damage caused by desires, drunkenness, and overindulgence harms Yin; when Yin is harmed, the illness inevitably rises from below and ascends. As the classic states: "Illnesses of the two Yangs affect the heart and spleen, resulting in issues such as failure to hide one's true condition, and similar cases in women when their monthly cycle is disrupted," which exemplifies the descent from above. Furthermore, the classic mentions: "The five viscera govern the storage of essence; thus, they must not be harmed. If they are harmed, they lose their protective function resulting in Yin deficiency. With Yin deficiency, there is no vital energy, and without vital energy, death follows." This illustrates the ascent from below. In essence, conditions arising from above tend to first deplete the vital energy.[164p]

故一损损于肺，则病在声息肤腠；二损损于心，则病在血脉颜色；三损损于胃，则病在饮食不调；四损损于肝，则病为瘈瘲疼痛；五损损于肾，则病为骨痿，二便不禁。此先伤于阳而后及乎阴，阳竭于下则孤阴无以独存，不可为也。自下而上者，先伤乎精。故一损损于肾，则病为泉源干涸；二损损于肝，则病为血动筋枯；三损损于脾，则病为痰涎壅盛；四损损于心，则病为神魂失守；五损损于肺，则病为喘急短气。此先伤乎阴而后及乎阳，阴竭于上则孤阳无以独生，不可为也。故曰：心肺损而神衰，肝肾虚而形敝，脾胃损而食饮不归血气。凡明哲之士，则当察所由而预防其渐，又何虚损之可虑？若待源流俱竭，而后归罪于药之不效，医之不良，此其愚也亦甚矣！[165p]

Thus, if damage occurs to the lungs, the illness manifests in voice and skin; if damage occurs to the heart, the illness is reflected in blood vessels and complexion; if damage occurs to the stomach, the illness results in improper intake of food; if damage occurs to the liver, the illness leads to pain and convulsions; if damage occurs to the kidneys, the illness results in bone weakness and inability to control urination. This initially injures the yang and subsequently affects the yin; when the yang is exhausted below, there can be no solitary existence of the yin, which is not feasible.

From below to above, the injury first affects the essence. Thus, if damage occurs to the kidneys, the illness manifests as a dried-up source; if damage occurs to the liver, the illness leads to blood movement and muscle depletion; if damage occurs to the spleen, the illness results in excessive phlegm and dampness; if damage occurs to the heart, the illness leads to loss of spirit and soul; if damage occurs to the lungs, the illness manifests as wheezing and shortness of breath. This first injures the yin and subsequently affects the yang; when the yin is exhausted above, there can be no solitary existence of the yang, which is not feasible.

Therefore, it is said: when the heart and lungs are damaged, the spirit weakens; when the liver and kidneys are deficient, the body deteriorates; when the spleen and stomach are damaged, food and drink do not nourish the vital energy. Any wise person should observe the causes and take preventive measures against gradual decline. Why worry about potential deficiencies? If one waits until both sources are depleted and then blames the ineffectiveness of medication or the shortcomings of the physician, this is indeed a profound foolishness![165p]

Ginger and Licorice Decoction with Dragon Bone and Oyster Shell

  • Ingredients: 3 taels of cinnamon twig, 3 taels of peony root, 3 taels of fresh ginger, 12 jujubes, 3 taels of dragon bone, 3 taels of oyster shell, 2 taels of licorice.
  • Method: Take these seven ingredients, use 7 sheng of water, boil down to 3 sheng, and divide into three warm doses.

Tian Xiong Powder

  • Ingredients: 3 taels of Tian Xiong (a type of herb), 3 taels of dragon bone, 8 taels of white atractylodes, 6 taels of cinnamon twig.
  • Method: Grind these four ingredients into a powder, take half a money spoonful with wine, three times a day, and increase gradually if necessary.

Yam Pill

  • Ingredients: 30 fen of yam, 7 fen each of ginseng and donkey hide gelatin, 10 fen each of dried rehmannia, angelica, cinnamon twig, and malt, 6 fen each of lily bulb, fangfeng, cyperus, peony root, white atractylodes, and apricot kernel, 5 fen each of bupleurum, platycodon root, and poria, 100 jujubes for paste, 3 fen of dried ginger, 2 fen of white radish, 28 fen of licorice.
  • Method: Grind these twenty-one ingredients into a fine powder, refine with honey, and form into pills the size of a marble. Take one pill on an empty stomach with wine; a total of 100 pills makes a complete dosage.[166p]

Sour Jujube Decoction
Two sheng of sour jujube seeds, one tael of licorice, two taels each of Anemarrhena, white Poria, and Chuanxiong. Additionally, two taels of fresh ginger. Combine these five ingredients with eight sheng of water. Boil the sour jujube seeds to yield six sheng, then add the other herbs and boil to obtain three sheng. Divide and take it warm in three doses.

Rhizoma Rhei and Insect Pills
Steam the rhubarb, ten parts, ten taels of prepared earth rhubarb, two taels of Scutellaria, one sheng each of peach kernels, apricot kernels, silkworms, and beetle larvae, four taels of white peony root, three taels of licorice, one tael of varnish tree, and one half sheng of water leeches (both prepared and unprepared). Grind these twelve ingredients into powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of adzuki beans, take five pills with wine, three times a day.

Qiánjīn Winged Licorice Decoction (also known as Recovery Pulse Decoction). Used for treating deficiency fatigue, excessive sweating with oppression, a bound pulse, and palpitations, similar conditions lasting no more than a hundred days may prove critical, with eleven days leading to potential death. Four taels of licorice (roasted), three taels each of cinnamon twig and fresh ginger, half sheng each of Ophiopogon and sesame seeds, two taels each of ginseng and donkey-hide gelatin, one jin of raw earth, and thirty jujubes. Combine these nine ingredients with seven sheng of wine and eight sheng of water. First, boil the eight ingredients, yielding three sheng; remove the dregs, dissolve the gelatin completely, and take one sheng warm, three times a day.[167p]

　　肘后獭肝散　治冷劳；又主鬼疰，一门相染。　　獭肝一具

　　天灵明月丹 【华佗，下同】 　治传尸　　雄黄　木香各半两　鳖甲制　轻粉各一分　兔粪二两　天灵盖炙，一两　　右为末，用法酒一大升，大黄半两，熬膏，入前药，为丸弹子大，朱砂为衣。传尸劳肌瘦面黄，呕吐咳嗽不定，先烧安息香，令烟尽吸之，不嗽非传尸也，不可用此药。若烟入口咳而不能禁止，乃传尸也，宜用此药。五更初服，勿使人知，以童子小便同酒共一盏，化一丸服之。如人行二十里止，吐出虫，其状如灯心而细长及寸，或如烂李，又如虾(虫麻)，状各不同。未效，次日再服，以应为度。
　　地黄煎丸　解劳生肌，进食活血养心。　　法酒二升　生地汁　杏仁汁　生姜汁　藕汁　薄荷汁各五升　鹅梨汁一升　沙蜜四两　　右，慢火熬成膏，入后药：[168p]

The Elbow-After Otter Liver Powder treats cold exhaustion and is also effective against ghostly afflictions, related through familial connections. One complete otter liver, dried and powdered, is mixed with water, taken in doses the size of a finger, three times a day.

Heavenly Spirit Bright Moon Pill (Hua Tuo, same as below) treats the condition known as "transmitted corpse." The formula includes half a tael each of realgar (雄黄) and wood aromatic (木香), one part of turtle shell (鳖甲) powder, one part of light powder, two taels of rabbit feces, and one tael of roasted heavenly spirit cover. Grind these into a powder and use with a large sheng of liquor, half a tael of rhubarb, boil together to make a paste, form into pills the size of a bullet, and coat with cinnabar. This treats transmitted corpse associated with emaciation, yellow complexion, and variable symptoms of vomiting and coughing; first, burn incense and let the smoke be inhaled. If there is no cough, it is not transmitted corpse, and this medicine should not be used. If the smoke makes one cough and cannot be suppressed, then it is transmitted corpse and this medicine should be applied. Take the first dose at the beginning of the fifth watch, discreetly, using a boy’s urine mixed with liquor in a goblet, dissolving one pill to consume. If after walking twenty li one vomits worms, they may appear long and thin like the wick of a lamp, or similar to decayed plums, or like shrimp (worm hemp), each differing in appearance. If ineffective, take again the next day as needed.

Earth Yellow Pill alleviates fatigue and generates flesh, enhancing consumption and nourishing the heart. The prescription includes two sheng of alcohol, five sheng each of fresh rhubarb juice, almond juice, ginger juice, lotus root juice, and mint juice, one sheng of pear juice, and four taels of sand honey. Prepare by slowly boiling these into a paste, then combine with the following recipe.[168p]

Shan Zhu Yu (Cornelian Cherry), Gan Cao (Licorice), Gui Xin (Cinnamon Heart) each 3 taels; Tao Ren (Peach Kernel), Bai Zi Ren, Xi Xin (Asarum), Fu Ling, Fang Feng (Saposhnikovia) each 2 taels; 24 Da Zao (Dates).

Qian Li Liu Shui Decoction treats insomnia due to deficiency and agitation.

Mai Men Dong (Ophiopogon), Ban Xia (Pinellia) each 3 taels; Fu Ling 4 taels; Zhu Mi (Sorghum) 1 dou; Suan Zao Ren (Sour Jujube Seed) 2 sheng; Gan Cao, Gui Xin, Huang Qin (Scutellaria), Yuan Zhi, Bi Xie (Dioscorea), Ren Shen, Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger) each 2 taels.

　　栀子汤　治大下后，虚劳不得眠，剧者颠倒，懊憹欲死。　　大栀子十四枚　豉七合

Gardenia Decoction: Treats insomnia following severe diarrhea and severe fatigue. If symptoms are severe, the patient may feel disoriented and have a strong desire to die.

Ingredients:

  • 14 pieces of gardenia fruit
  • 7 qian of fermented soybeans

Preparation: Combine the two ingredients with 4 sheng of water. First, boil the gardenia to extract 2.5 sheng, then add the fermented soybeans and boil for three more times, straining out the residue. Take 1 sheng of the decoction; if the patient feels settled, do not continue taking it. If there is upper gastrointestinal distress and nausea, add 2 liang of tangerine peel and optionally 2 liang of fresh ginger.

Morinda Root Wine: Treats weakness, impotence, and various ailments causing fatigue. It can help in digestion.

Ingredients:

  • 2 jin each of the following: Morinda root, Achyranthes root, white bark of goji root, Ophiopogon root, rehmannia root, and Siler root.

Preparation: Use these six herbs fresh. If not available, dried versions are acceptable. Crush and soak them in 1 shi and 4 dou of wine for seven days, then strain and take warm. Always maintain a light wine level and avoid intoxication. Be cautious with cold foods like pig, fish, oil, and garlic.

Dosage: For spring, take for 7 days; for autumn and winter, take for 14 days; do not take in summer. For those with previous cold conditions, add 1 jin each of dried ginger and cinnamon bark. For forgetfulness, add 1 jin of polygala root. For severe exhaustion, add 1 jin each of Schisandra and chinese epimedium. For dampness in the lower body, add 1 jin each of five-needle stem and dendrobium.

For each additional jin of herbs, add 7 sheng of wine. It is recommended to prepare this in mid-September and start taking in early October. For leftover herbs, consume them with this wine, yielding excellent results.

The residue should be dried and ground into a powder; take a spoonful daily, three times a day for best effects. Long-term use can include an additional 10 liang of licorice; for weakness, add 1 jin of astragalus root.[170p]

　　五加酒　治虚劳不足。

　　天门冬大煎　治男子五劳七伤，八风十二痹，伤中六极。　　天门冬　生地黄各切，三斗半，捣压尽取汁　獐骨一具，捣碎，以水一石，煮取五斗澄清　白蜜　酥各三升，并炼　枸杞根切，三斗，净洗，以水二石五，煮取一斗三升，澄清　　右六味，内大斗铜器中，微火先煎门冬、地黄汁减半，乃合煎取大斗二斗，下后件散药，煎取一斗，内铜器重釜煎，令隐掌，可丸如梧子大，平旦空腹酒服二十丸，日二，加至五十丸。慎生冷酢滑猪鸡鱼蒜油面等。须择四时王相日修合。[171p]

Wujia Wine is used to treat deficiency from overwork.

Ingredients:

  • Astragalus peel and Goji root, each one斗.

For the two ingredients: chop them, use 5石 of water to boil and extract 7斗 of juice. Divide and take out 4斗, soak in 1斗 of original extract, and mix the remaining 3斗 with rice as usual. Ferment and compress it to take as needed. Treat it like medicine, abstaining from heavy work during the day.

Heavenly Dong is cooked to treat men's ailments from five labors and seven injuries, eight winds, twelve damp afflictions, and six extremes.

Ingredients:

  • Heavenly Dong and fresh Rehmannia, chopped, 3.5斗. Mash to extract juice.
  • A whole deer bone, crushed, with water 1石, boil to extract 5斗 of clear juice.
  • White honey and clarified butter, each 3升, refined.
  • Goji root, cleaned, 3斗, boiled in 2石5 of water to extract 1斗3升 of clear juice.

Combine the six ingredients in a large copper vessel, simmer the Heavenly Dong and Rehmannia juice until reduced by half, then combine and boil to yield 2斗, add the remaining powdered ingredients, and boil down to 1斗. In a heavy copper pot, simmer until it thickens, then form into pills about the size of a walnut. Take 20 pills on an empty stomach in the morning with wine, increasing to 50 pills daily. Avoid raw, cold, acidic, slippery foods like pork, chicken, fish, garlic, and oily noodles. Choose favorable days based on seasonal harmonies.[171p]

散药如左：　　茯苓　桂心　白朮　萎蕤　五加皮　菖蒲　远志　泽泻　薯蓣　人参　柏子仁　石斛　牛膝　杜仲　细辛　独活　覆盆子　胡麻子　枳实　芎藭　大豆黄卷　黄芪　苁蓉　续断　狗脊　萆薢　白芷　橘皮　茯神　巴戟天　石楠各二两　阿胶十两　甘草六两　蜀椒　薏苡仁一升　鹿角胶五两　蔓荆子三两　大枣一百枚，煮作膏　　右三十八味，治下筛内煎，中有牛髓、鹿髓各加三升，大佳。小便濇，去柏子仁，加秦艽二两、干地黄六两。阴痿失精，去萎蕤，加五味子二两。头风，去柏子仁，加菊花、防风各二两。小便利阴气弱，去细辛、防风，加山茱萸二两。腹中冷，去防风，加干姜二两。此煎九月下旬采药，立冬日合服，至五月上旬止。若十二月腊日合者，经夏至七月下旬止。若经夏不坏，于舍北阴处，入地深六尺填沙，置药中，上加沙覆之。女人先患热者得服，患冷者勿服。[172p]

The medicinal ingredients are as follows:

These 38 ingredients are meant to treat internal issues; add 3 sheng of cow and deer marrow, which is excellent. For difficulty in urination, remove Biota Seed and add 2 taels of Gentian and 6 taels of Rehmannia. For impotence with loss of essence, remove Curcuma and add 2 taels of Schisandra. For headaches, remove Biota Seed and add 2 taels each of Chrysanthemum and Siler. For weak yin energy in urination, remove Asarum and Siler, and add 2 taels of Cornelian Cherry. 　　填骨万金煎　治内劳少气，寒疝里急，腹中喘逆，腰脊痛。　　生地黄三十斤，取汁　肉苁蓉　甘草　牛髓　阿胶各一斤　麦门冬　干地黄各二斤　干姜　桑根　白皮　茯苓　桂心各八两　人参　桔梗　五味子　附子炮，各五两　石斛一斤五两　白蜜十斤　清酒四斗　大枣一百五十枚　麻子仁三升　当归十四两　干漆二十两　蜀椒四两　　右二十三味，先以清酒二斗六升，内桑根白皮、麻子仁、枣胶，为刻识之；又加酒一斗四升，煮取至刻，绞去滓，内蜜髓地黄汁汤，上铜器煎，内诸药末，半日许，令可丸止，大瓮盛，饮吞如弹丸一枚，日三。若夏月暑热煮煎转味，可以蜜地黄汁和诸药成末，为丸如梧子，服十五丸。不止，稍加至三十丸。　　又方　治男子风虚劳损兼时气。[173p]

Fill the bone with a precious elixir. It treats internal exhaustion, cold hernia, urgent abdominal conditions, dyspnea, and pain in the waist and spine.

Take thirty catties of raw Rehmannia and extract its juice. Use one catty each of meat from Cistanche, licorice, cattle marrow, and donkey-hide glue; two catties each of Ophiopogon and dried Rehmannia; eight taels each of dried ginger, mulberry root, white peony, poria, and cinnamon heart; five taels each of ginseng, balloon flower, Schisandra, and processed aconite; one catty and five taels of dendrobium; ten catties of white honey; four dou of clear wine; one hundred and fifty jujubes; three sheng of sesame seed; fourteen taels of Angelica; twenty taels of lacquer; and four taels of Sichuan pepper.

The above twenty-three ingredients: first, with two dou and six sheng of clear wine, soak the mulberry root, white peony, sesame seeds, and jujube glue for identification; then, add another dou and four sheng of wine, and boil down until marked, strain out the residue, and mix in the honey, marrow, and Rehmannia juice soup. In a copper vessel, decoct, then add the powdered herbs and simmer for half a day until it can be formed into pills. Store in a large jar and take one pill three times a day, as if swallowing a bullet. If taken during the hot summer months, change the decoction and mix the medicine with honey and Rehmannia juice to form pills the size of a walnut, taking fifteen pills initially, and if necessary, increase to thirty pills.

Another method treats men suffering from wind-heat-induced exhaustion and seasonal illnesses.[173p]

One pound of licorice, four taels each of dendrobium, siler, cistanche, poria, ginseng, cornelian cherry, and dioscorea; three taels each of cassia, achyranthes, schisandra, dodder, morinda, and chuanxiong, all ground into powder.

Three sheng each of ox marrow, white honey, and fresh ophiopogon juice; one sheng each of fresh rehmannia juice and chopped rehmannia peel; two taels of salvia.

These twenty-two ingredients are prepared as follows: first, boil rehmannia and rehmannia peel with sesame juice until reduced by half, then add the ox marrow, honey, ginger, and ophiopogon juices in equal parts. 　　补虚方[175p]

Dihuang Xiaojian: Treats the five labors and seven injuries, weakness and emaciation.

  • 1 sheng of dried dihuang powder
  • 0.5 jin of sesame oil
  • 2 sheng of white honey
  • 1 jin of pig fat

Combine these four ingredients, simmer in a copper pot until they can be formed into balls the size of a walnut. Take three balls daily, three times a day, gradually increasing to ten balls over time for ongoing benefits. Those who are skinny and dark should gain weight.

Lu Kang Gao: Treats cold weakness and emaciation, lack of vitality.

  • 2 sheng each of beef marrow and sheep fat
  • 3 sheng each of clarified butter, ginger juice, and white honey

First, simmer the butter until melted, then add ginger juice, followed by honey, and finally sheep fat and beef marrow. Simmer on low heat, stirring three times up and down until the steam from the ginger juice has dissipated, then stir until it solidifies. Drink warm with wine, no limit on quantity, to promote health and warmth.

Another method: Treats the five labors and seven injuries.

Take one set of the head and hooves of a white sheep, clean and treat it, burn it with straw fire until yellowish-red, then use clean cotton to plug the nose and brain openings.

  • 1 liang each of pepper, cubeb, and dried ginger
  • 1 sheng of green onion whites
  • 2 sheng of fermented soybeans

First, boil the head and hooves until half-cooked, then add the herbs and boil until thoroughly tender. Discard the herbs and consume at your desired temperature, one whole set a day for seven days. Avoid raw, cold, sour, slippery, and aged foods.

Vitality Supplement Formula[175p]

　　猪肚一具　人参五两　蜀椒　干姜各一两半　葱白七两　白粱米半升　　右六味(口父)咀，诸药令相得，和米内肚中，缝合勿泄气，水四斗半，缓火烂煮，空腹食，大佳。兼下少饭。
　　干地黄圆　治血虚劳，胸腹烦满，疼痛，瘀血往来，脏虚不受谷，气逆不得食，补中理血。　　干地黄三两　当归　干姜　麦门冬　甘草　黄芩各二两　人参五分　厚朴　干漆　枳实　防风　大黄　细辛　白朮各一两　茯苓五两　蝱虫　(上庶下虫)虫各五十枚　前胡六分　　右十八味为末，蜜丸如梧子大，先食服十丸，日三，稍加。
　　茯苓补心汤　治心气不足，善悲愁恚怒，衄血面黄，烦闷，五心热，或独语不觉，咽喉痛，舌本强，冷涎出，或汗出，善忘，恐走不定。　　茯苓四两　桂心　甘草各二两　紫石英　人参各一两　大枣二十枚　麦门冬三两　赤小豆二十四枚　　右八味(口父)咀，以水七升，煮取二升，分三服。
　　牛髓圆　通治百病，虚瘠羸乏。[176p]

Here is the translated text:

"One pig's stomach, five taels of ginseng, one and a half taels each of Sichuan pepper and dried ginger, seven taels of scallion whites, half a sheng of glutinous rice. Mix these six ingredients (mouth and father), ensuring they complement each other. Stuff them into the stomach with the rice, sew it up tightly to prevent gas from escaping. Use four and a half dou of water, simmer it slowly until cooked thoroughly, and consume on an empty stomach; it is excellent. Additionally, one can consume a small amount of rice.

Dried rehmannia treat blood deficiency and exhaustion, chest and abdomen fullness and pain, stagnated blood, weak organs unable to digest grains, and reverse qi causing inability to eat; it nourishes and regulates blood. Three taels of dried rehmannia, two taels each of angelica, dried ginger, ophiopogonis, licorice, and baical skullcap, five fen of ginseng, one tael each of acronychia, varnish tree, bitter orange, fangfeng, rhubarb, xixin, and atractylodes, five taels of poria, fifty pieces each of cicada molting and worm, six fen of mulberry root. Grind these eighteen ingredients into a powder, form into honey balls the size of walnuts, and take ten balls before meals three times a day, gradually increasing.

Poria Heart Supplement Soup treats insufficient heart qi, propensity for sadness, anger, ochre complexion, mental agitation, heat in the five hearts, or talking to oneself unknowingly, throat pain, a strong tongue, cold saliva discharge, possible sweating, forgetfulness, and unstable walking. Four taels of poria, two taels each of cinnamon heart and licorice, one tael each of purple quartz and ginseng, twenty jujubes, three taels of ophiopogonis, and twenty-four pieces of adzuki bean. Grind these eight ingredients (mouth and father) with seven sheng of water, boil to two sheng, and divide into three doses.

Bovine marrow pills treat a hundred ailments, weakness, and frailty."[176p]

　　牛髓　羊髓　枣膏　白蜜　酥各一升　芎藭　麦门冬　桂心　当归　茯苓一云茯神　甘草　羌活各三十铢　干地黄　干姜各三十六铢　五味子　人参　防风各一两　细辛十八铢　白朮四十二铢　　右十九味，捣十四味，再筛别研，枣膏和散，次与诸髓蜜，搅令相得，内铜钵中，于釜沸汤中煎，取堪为丸如梧子大，酒服三十丸，加至四十丸，日再服。
　　大补心汤　治虚损不足，心气弱悸，或时妄语，四肢损变，气力颜色不荣。　　黄芩　附子各一两　干地黄　茯苓　麦门冬　甘草　桂心　阿胶各三两　饴糖一斤　半夏　远志　石膏各四两　生姜六两　大枣二十枚　　右十四味，取十三味(口父)咀，以水一斗五升，煮取五升，汤成下糖，分四服。
　　温脾圆　治久病虚羸，脾气弱，食不消，喜噫。　　黄蘗　大麦糵　吴茱萸　桂心　干姜　细辛　附子　当归　大黄　曲　黄连各一两　　右十一味为末，蜜丸如梧子，每服十五丸，空腹酒服，日三。[177p]

Beef marrow, lamb marrow, jujube paste, white honey, and powdered fat, each one sheng; Chuanxiong, Ophiopogon, cinnamon heart, Angelica sinensis, Poria (also known as Fu Shen), Glycyrrhiza, and Qianghuo, each thirty zhu; dried Rehmannia and dried ginger, each thirty-six zhu; Schisandra, ginseng, and Fangfeng, each one liang; Xixin eighteen zhu; Atractylodes forty-two zhu. The above nineteen ingredients: grind fourteen of them, then sift and grind separately. Mix the jujube paste with the powder, then add all the marrows and honey, stirring until well combined. In a copper bowl, stew in boiling water until it can be formed into pills the size of walnuts. Take thirty pills with wine, increasing to forty pills, twice daily.

Great Heart-Replenishing Decoction is for treating deficiencies and weakness, weak heart qi, occasional delirium, limbs being affected, and color and vitality lacking. Huangqin and Fuzi, each one liang; dried Rehmannia, Poria, Ophiopogon, Glycyrrhiza, cinnamon heart, Ejiao, each three liang; rock parsnip, Yuan Zhi, and gypsum, each four liang; fresh ginger six liang; and twenty jujubes. The above fourteen ingredients: take thirteen of them and grind; with one斗 five sheng of water, boil down to five sheng. Once ready, add sugar and divide into four doses.

Warm Spleen Pill is for long-term illness with weakness, weak spleen qi, indigestion, and tendency to belch. Huangbo, barley malt, Wu Zhu Yu, cinnamon heart, dried ginger, Xixin, Fuzi, Angelica sinensis, rhubarb, Qu, and Huanglian, each one liang. The above eleven ingredients: make into powder, form into pills like walnuts, and take fifteen pills each time, with wine on an empty stomach, three times daily.[177p]

　　右二味治下筛，饮和服一合，日四五，任情多少。　　又方　治骨蒸热羸瘦，烦闷短气，喘息鼻张，日西即发。　　龙胆　黄连　(艹舌)蒌根各四分　芒硝二分　栀子十枚　苦参　大黄　黄芩　青葙子　芍药各二两　　右十味为末，蜜丸如梧子大，饮服二丸，日二，以止为度。一方无苦参已下，止五味。
　　补肺汤　治肺气不足，逆满上气，咽中闷塞，短气，寒从背起，口中如含霜，言语失声，甚者吐血。　　五味子三两　干姜　桂心　(艹款)冬花各二两　麦门冬一升　大枣一百枚　桑根白皮一斤　粳米二合　　右八味(口父)咀，以水一斗，先煮桑白皮五沸，下药煮取三升，分三服。　　又方　专治肺气不足，咳逆上气，牵绳而坐，吐沫唾血，不能饮食。[178p]

Ma Dou San: For those with weak spleen energy who cannot take food, take this as a meal replacement. Use two sheng of yellow soybeans and three sheng of hemp seeds, boil until fragrant. Mix these two ingredients and take one he, four to five times a day, as desired.

Another formula: For treating bone-heat, weakness, restlessness, shortness of breath, and flaring nostrils, which occur in the west of the day. Use four fen each of Gentian, Coptis, and Ma Huang root; two fen of Glauber's salt; ten Zhi zi (gardenia fruit); two liang each of Kushen (bitter，genus), Dahuang (rhubarb), Huangqin (Scutellaria), Qingsangzi (bluebell seed), and Shaoyao (peony root). Grind these ten ingredients into a powder and form into pills the size of a walnut. Take two pills twice a day, adjusting as needed. The version without Kushen should only include the five ingredients.

Bu Fei Tang: For insufficient lung energy, rebellious fullness, a feeling of blockage in the throat, shortness of breath, cold rising from the back, a mouth feeling as if filled with frost, loss of voice, and in severe cases, coughing up blood. Use three liang of Schisandra fruit, two liang each of dried ginger and cinnamon heart, and Donghua (winter flower); one sheng of Ophiopogon; one hundred jujubes; one jin of white mulberry root bark; and two he of japonica rice. Crush these eight ingredients and boil in ten dou of water, first boiling the mulberry bark until it has boiled five times, then add the medicines to extract three sheng, divided into three doses.

Another formula: Specifically for treating insufficient lung energy, rebellious cough, shortness of breath while seated, foaming at the mouth with blood, inability to eat or drink.[178p]

　　苏子一升　桑白皮五两　半夏六两　紫菀　人参　甘草　五味子　杏仁各二两　(艹款)冬花　射干各半两　麻黄　干姜　桂心各三两　细辛一两半　　右十四味(口父)咀，以水一斗二升，煮取三升半，分五服，日三夜二。　　又方　治肾气虚寒，阴痿，腰脊痛，身重缓弱，言音混浊，阳气顿绝。　　苁蓉　白朮　巴戟天　麦门冬　茯苓　甘草　牛膝　五味子　杜仲各八两　生干地黄五斤　车前子　干姜各五两　　右十二味，治下筛，食后酒服方寸匕，日三。　　又方　治五劳六极，虚羸心惊，尫弱多魇，亡阳。　　茯苓四两　甘草　芍药　桂心　干姜各三两　大枣五枚　远志　人参各二两　　右八味(口父)咀，以水八升，煮取三升，分三服。[179p]

Suzi 1 sheng, Sangbai Pi 5 liang, Banjia 6 liang, Zihuan, Renshen, Gancao, Wuweizi, Xingren each 2 liang; Donghua and Shegan each 0.5 liang; Mahuang, Ganjing, Guixin each 3 liang; Xixin 1.5 liang.

These fourteen ingredients should be ground, mixed with 12 sheng of water, boiled to obtain 3.5 sheng, and divided into five doses, taken three times a day and twice at night.

Another formula for treating kidney qi deficiency and cold, impotence, pain in the waist and spine, sluggishness, confusion of speech, and sudden loss of yang consists of:

Cuirong, Baitang, Bajitian, Maidong, Fuling, Gancao, Niuxi, Wuweizi, and Duzhong each 8 liang; Sheng Gande Huang 5 jin; Cheqianzi and Ganjing each 5 liang.

This twelve-ingredient formula treats lower back pain and is taken after meals with wine using a tongue-sized spoon, three times a day.

Another formula to treat the five labors and six extremes, weakness, heart palpitations, excessive fatigue, and loss of yang includes:

Fuling 4 liang, Gancao, Shaoyao, Guixin, and Ganjing each 3 liang; Dazao 5 pieces; Yuanzhi and Renshen each 2 liang.

These eight ingredients should be ground, mixed with 8 sheng of water, boiled to obtain 3 sheng, and divided into three doses.[179p]

　　建中汤　治五劳七伤，小腹急痛，膀胱虚满，手足逆冷，苦吐酸痰，呕逆泄下，少气，目眩耳聋，口焦，小便自利。　　胶饴半斤　黄芪　干姜　当归各三两　人参　半夏　橘皮　芍叶　甘草各二两　附子一两　大枣十五枚　　右十一味(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升半，汤成，下胶饴烊沸，分四服。　　又方　治五劳七伤，虚羸不足，面目黧黑，手足疼痛，久立腰疼，起则目眩，腹中悬急而有绝伤，外引四肢。　　生姜　芍药　干地黄　甘草　芎藭各五两　大枣三十枚　　右六味(口父)咀，以水六升，渍一宿，明旦复以水五升，合煮取三升，分三服。药入，四肢百脉似醉状是效。无生姜，酒渍干姜二两一宿用之。常行此方神妙。[180p]

Jianzhong Decoction treats the five strains and seven injuries, acute pain in the lower abdomen, a full sensation in the bladder, cold extremities, bitter vomiting with sour phlegm, retching and diarrhea, shortness of breath, dizziness, deafness, dry mouth, and spontaneous urination.

Ingredients:

  • Half a pound of honey-infused sugar
  • Three taels each of astragalus, dried ginger, and angelica
  • Two taels each of ginseng, pinellia, tangerine peel, peony root, and licorice
  • One tael of aconite
  • Fifteen jujubes.

Take these eleven ingredients, chew them together, add one dou of water, and boil down to three and a half sheng. Once the decoction is complete, dissolve the honey-infused sugar while boiling and divide into four doses.

Another formula treats the five strains and seven injuries, deficiencies and emaciation, dark complexion, pain in the hands and feet, back pain from prolonged standing, dizziness upon rising, urgent and intense abdominal pain with severing sensations that radiate to the limbs.

Ingredients:

  • Five taels of fresh ginger, peony, dried rehmannia, licorice, and sparganium
  • Thirty jujubes.

Take these six ingredients, chew them together, soak in six sheng of water overnight, and the next morning add five sheng of water and boil down to three sheng. Divide into three doses. When the medicine is taken, the limbs and hundreds of pulses feel as if intoxicated, indicating effectiveness. If fresh ginger is unavailable, use two taels of dried ginger soaked in wine overnight. This formula is often effective and miraculous.[180p]

　　大建中汤　治虚劳寒澼，饮在胁下，决决有声，饮已如从一边下，决决然也，有头并冲皮起引两乳，内痛里急，善梦失精，气痛，目(目巟)(目巟)，惚惚多忘。　　蜀椒二合　半夏一升　生姜一斤　甘草二两　人参三两　饴糖八两　　右六味(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮三升，去滓，内糖温服七合。里急拘引，加芍药、桂心各三两。手足厥，腰背冷，加附子一枚。劳者，加黄芪一两。
　　小建中汤　凡男女因积劳虚损，或大病后不复常，苦四体沉滞，骨肉疼酸，吸吸少气，行动喘惙，或小腹拘急，腰背强痛，心中虚悸，咽干唇燥，面体少色，或饮食无味，阴阳废弱，悲忧惨戚，多卧少起，皆如方治之。　　甘草二两　桂心　生姜各三两　芍药六两　胶饴一升　大枣十二枚　　右六味(口父)咀，以水九升，煮取三升，去滓，内胶饴，每服一升，日三。间三日，复作一剂，后可与诸丸散。[181p]

Da Jian Zhong Decoction treats deficiency, cold, and fluid retention. When drinking, a gurgling sound is heard under the ribs, as if it is flowing down from one side, causing a similar sound. It raises and disturbs both breasts, causing internal pain and urgency, dreams of losing essence, Qi pain, dizziness, and frequent forgetfulness.

Ingredients:

  • 2 parts Sichuan pepper
  • 1 sheng of pinellia
  • 1 jin of fresh ginger
  • 2 taels of licorice
  • 3 taels of ginseng
  • 8 taels of honey

Prepare these six ingredients, grind them, and boil with 10 dou of water to yield 3 sheng. Strain and add honey, taking 7 sheng warm. For internal urgency, add 3 taels each of peony root and cinnamon heart. For hands and feet going numb and cold in the waist and back, add 1 piece of aconite. For those who are fatigued, add 1 tael of astragalus.

Xiao Jian Zhong Decoction is for men and women who suffer from exhaustion leading to deficiency, or for those who, after a serious illness, have not returned to normal, suffering from heaviness throughout the body, aches in bones and muscles, shortness of breath, breathlessness on movement, or cramping and pain in the lower abdomen, accompanied by a strong pain in the waist and back, palpitations, dryness in the throat, chapped lips, a pale complexion, lack of taste in food, weakness of both Yin and Yang, feelings of sadness and melancholy, excessive lying down, and minimal getting up, all of which should be treated with this formula.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of licorice
  • 3 taels each of cinnamon heart and fresh ginger
  • 6 taels of peony root
  • 1 sheng of honey
  • 12 jujubes

Prepare these six ingredients, grind them, and boil with 9 sheng of water to yield 3 sheng. Strain and add honey, taking 1 sheng each time, three times a day. After three days, prepare another dose, and subsequently, this can be combined with various pills and powders.[181p]

Qian Hu Jian Zhong Decoction: This treats great labor deficiency, cold-heat and vomiting, lower jiao (the lower part of the body) deficiency heat, painful and reddish urination, heat rising to the head, as well as bone and muscle pain, and dry mouth. Huang Qi Jian Zhong Decoction: This treats deficiency and internal urgency, along with general insufficiency. Ingredients: Huang Qi (3 taels), Sheng Jiang (3 taels), peeled Gui (3 taels), Gan Cao (2 taels), Shao Yao (6 taels), 12 Da Zao (dates), and 1 sheng of honey sugar. Combine the ten ingredients, crush, and boil in 1 dou of water to yield 3 sheng, then strain and let the honey dissolve. Take 1 sheng warm, three times a day, on alternate days as needed. For those who experience vomiting, increase Sheng Jiang, and for abdominal distension, omit the dates and add 4 taels of Fu Ling, which is preferable.[182p]

　　黄芪汤　治虚劳不足，四肢烦疼，不欲食，食即胀，汗出。　　黄芪　麦门冬　芍药　桂心各三两　甘草　当归　五味子　细辛　人参各二两　生姜　半夏各八两　大枣二十枚　白茯苓四两　前胡六两　　右十四味(口父)咀，以水一斗四升，煮取三升，每服八合，日二服。
　　乐令黄芪汤　治虚劳少气，胸心淡冷，时惊惕，心中悸动，手脚逆冷，体常自汗，五脏六腑虚损，肠鸣，风湿荣卫不调百病，补诸不足。又治中风里急。　　黄芪　人参　橘皮　当归　桂心　细辛　前胡　芍药　甘草　麦门冬　茯苓各一两　生姜五两　半夏二两半　大枣二十枚　　右十四味(口父)咀，以水二斗，煮取四升，每服五合，日三夜一。[183p]

Huangqi Decoction treats deficiency labor, insufficient energy, pain and discomfort in the limbs, loss of appetite, distension upon eating, and sweating.

  • Huangqi (Astragalus): 3 taels

  • Bai Fu Ling (Poria): 4 taels

These 14 ingredients are to be finely chopped and boiled in 14 liters of water until 3 liters remain. Take 8 ounces each time, twice a day.

Le Ling Huangqi Decoction treats deficiency labor with low energy, cold feeling in the chest and heart, occasional fright, palpitations, cold hands and feet, spontaneous sweating, weakness of the five organs and six bowels, intestinal rumbling, and imbalance of wind and dampness leading to various diseases, nourishing deficiencies. These 14 ingredients are to be finely chopped and boiled in 20 liters of water until 4 liters remain. Take 5 ounces each time, three times a day and once at night.[183p]

　　肾沥汤　治虚劳损羸乏，咳逆气短，四肢烦疼，腰背相引痛，耳鸣面黧黯，骨间热，小便赤黄，心悸目眩，诸虚乏。　　羊肾一具　桂心一两　磁石五两　人参　泽泻　五味子　甘草　防风　芎藭　地骨皮　黄芪　当归各二两　茯苓　元参　芍药　生姜各四两　　右十六味(口父)咀，以水一斗五升，先煮肾取一斗，去肾入药，煎取三升，分三服，可常服之。
　　增损肾沥汤　治大虚不足，小便数，嘘吸焦燆引饮，膀胱满急。每年三伏中常服此三剂，于方中商量用之。　　羊肾一具　麦门冬　地骨皮　人参　石斛　泽泻　(艹舌)蒌根　干地黄各四两　远志　生姜　甘草　当归　桂心　桑白皮一作桑寄生　茯苓　五味子各二两　大枣三十枚　　右十七味(口父)咀，以水一斗五升，先煮肾取一斗二升，去肾内药，煮取三升，去滓，分三服。[184p]

Shen Li Decoction: Treats deficiency labor, weakness, cough with reversed qi, shortness of breath, painful limbs, lumbar and back pain, tinnitus with a darkened face, heat in the bones, reddish-yellow urine, palpitations, dizziness, and various forms of deficiency and fatigue.

Ingredients: One sheep kidney, one ounce of cinnamon heart, five ounces of magnetite, two ounces each of ginseng, alisma, schisandra, licorice, fangfeng, xingren, earth bone peel, astragalus, and angelica. Four ounces each of poria, chinese bellflower, peony, and fresh ginger.

Preparation: Chop the above sixteen ingredients, boil with 15 liters of water, first extract one dou of kidney essence, discard the kidney, and then add the herbs. Boil down to three liters, divide into three doses. This can be taken regularly.

Enhanced Shen Li Decoction: Treats severe deficiency, frequent urination, desires for hot drinks, and urgency with a full bladder. Take this recipe in three doses during the hottest part of summer each year, adjusting the ingredients as needed.

Ingredients: One sheep kidney, four ounces each of ophiopogon, earth bone peel, ginseng, dendrobium, alisma, (root of a fragrant plant), and dried rehmannia; two ounces each of polygala, fresh ginger, licorice, angelica, cinnamon heart, mulberry bark (or mulberry mistletoe), poria, and schisandra; thirty dates.

　　五补汤　治五脏内虚竭，短气咳逆，伤损郁悒，下气通津液。　　五味子　桂心　甘草　人参各一两　麦门冬　小麦各一升　粳米三合　生姜八两　薤白　枸杞根白皮各一斤　　右十味，以水一斗二升，煮三升，每服一升，日三。口燥者，先煮竹叶一把，水减一升，去叶，内诸药煮。
　　人参汤　治男子五劳七伤，胸中逆满，害食乏气，呕逆，两胁下胀，小腹急痛，宛转欲死，调中平脏，理绝伤。　　人参　当归　芍药　甘草　生姜　麦门冬　白糖　桂心各二两　前胡　茯苓　五味子　蜀椒　橘皮各一两　枳实三两　大枣十五枚　　右十五味(口父)咀，取东流水一斗半，渍药半日，用三年陈芦梢，煎取四升，内糖，复上火煎令十数沸。年二十以上，六十以下，一服一升。二十以下，六十以上，一服七八合。虽年盛而久羸者，亦服七八合。日三夜一，不尔，药力不接，则不能救病。要用劳水陈芦，不则水强火盛猛，即药力不出也。[185p]

Wubu Decoction: This treats internal deficiency of the five organs, shortness of breath, cough with reverse flow, damage from stagnation and melancholy, and helps to move qi and fluids. Ginseng Decoction: This treats the five labors and seven injuries in men, reverse fullness in the chest, food stagnation with lack of qi, vomiting, fullness in both sides of the abdomen, urgent pain in the lower abdomen, and despondent distress, regulating the middle and restoring balance. Ingredients: 2 taels each of ginseng, angelica, peony, licorice, ginger, ophiopogon, white sugar, and cinnamon heart; 1 tael each of qianniu (fritillaria), poria, five-flavor fruit, Sichuan pepper, and orange peel; and 3 taels of bitter orange. Add 15 dates. Combine these fifteen ingredients, chew them well, and use 1.5斗 of flowing water to soak the medicine for half a day, using three-year-old reed tops to decoct for 4 liters, add sugar, then continue heating until boiling several times. For those aged 20 to under 60, take 1 liter. For those under 20 or over 60, take 7-8 he. Even for those who are young but have been weak for a long time, take 7-8 he. Three times a day and once at night; without this regimen, the medicinal strength will not take effect and cannot cure the illness. Be sure to use flowing water and aged reed; otherwise, if the water is too strong and the fire too intense, the medicine's efficacy will not be released.[185p]

　　内补散　治五劳六绝，心伤者，令人善惊，妄怒无常；脾伤者，令人腹满喜噫，食竟欲卧，面目痿黄；肺伤者，令人少精，腰背痛，四肢厥逆；肝伤者，令人少血面黑；肾伤者，有积聚，小腹腰背满痹，咳唾，小便难。六绝之为病，皆起于大劳脉虚，外受风邪，内受寒热，令人手足疼痛，膝以下冷，腹中雷鸣，时时泄痢，或闭或利，面目肿，心下愦愦，不欲语，憎闻人声。　　干地黄　菟丝子　山茱萸　地麦各五两　远志　巴戟天各半两　麦门冬　五味子　甘草　人参　苁蓉　石斛　桂心　茯苓　附子各一两　　右十五味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，日三加至三匕，无所禁。[186p]

Nei Bu San: Treats the five labors and six exhaustion. For those with heart injuries, they may experience excessive fright, irrational anger, and instability; those with spleen injuries may feel bloated, happy, and belch, wanting to sleep after eating, with a pale yellow face; those with lung injuries may have reduced vitality, back pain, and cold extremities; those with liver injuries may have reduced blood and a darkened face; those with kidney injuries may have masses, a heavy lower abdomen, back pain, coughing, difficulty urinating. The six exhaustion ailments arise from the deficiency of the major labor meridian, which is exposed to wind evil, experiencing internal cold and heat, causing pain in the hands and feet, cold below the knees, rumbling in the abdomen, frequent diarrhea, either constipation or loose stools, facial swelling, a feeling of confusion below the heart, unwillingness to speak, and aversion to human voices.

Shen Li San: Cures numerous ailments of deficiency and fatigue.

Zhong Ru San: Treats the five labors and seven injuries, especially for those with weakness and lack of energy.

Six taels of Zeolite, regardless of coarseness, must be white and free of any red, yellow, or black; a copper pot that holds two or three dou (about 30-45 liters) is needed, and add about two he of coarse sugar. Boil this for five or six bubbles, then add the milk water according to need, adjusting the amount as necessary. Strain out the residue with warm, clean water, dry it, and grind it noiselessly.

Take white deer antler; separate the white horse root and pound it; grind sulfur separately; one tael each of Dendrobium, Iron Essence, Ginseng, Magnetite, Cinnamon Heart, and Silk Worm; three taels of Snake Bed Seed.

These eleven ingredients are to be ground into powder, mixed with jujube paste and pounded 3,000 times, then take thirty pills the size of a walnut, twice daily. Be cautious in the bedroom and avoid cold, sour, greasy, or excessively old dishes.[187p]

　　石苇圆　黄帝问五劳七伤于高阳负。高阳负曰：一曰阴衰；二曰精清；三曰精少；四曰阴消；五曰囊下湿；六曰腰一作胸胁苦痛；七曰膝厥痛，不欲行，骨热，远视，泪出，口干，腹中鸣，时有热，小便淋沥，茎中痛，或精自出。有病如此，所谓七伤。一曰志劳，二曰思劳，三曰心劳，四曰忧劳，五曰疲劳，此谓五劳。黄帝曰：何以治之？高阳负曰：石苇丸主之。　　石苇　细辛　礜石　远志去心　茯苓　泽泻　菖蒲　杜仲　蛇床子　肉苁蓉　桔梗　天雄　牛膝　山茱萸　柏子仁　续断　薯蓣各二两　防风　赤石脂各三两　　右十九味为末，取枣膏如蜜和丸如梧子，酒服三十丸，日三，七日愈，二十日百病除，长服良。[188p]

Shi Wei Yuan: The Yellow Emperor asked about the five labors and seven injuries in relation to Gao Yang Fu. Gao Yang Fu replied: "First, there is the decline of yin; second, clarity of essence; third, deficiency of essence; fourth, the consumption of yin; fifth, dampness beneath the abdomen; sixth, pain in the waist that radiates to the chest and sides; seventh, knee pain, leading to an inability to walk, bone heat, distant vision, tears, dry mouth, rumbling in the abdomen, occasional warmth, dripping in urination, pain in the shaft, or spontaneous release of essence. When one is afflicted in this manner, these are known as the seven injuries. The first is the labor of ambition, the second is the labor of thinking, the third is the labor of the heart, the fourth is the labor of worry, and the fifth is the labor of fatigue; these are called the five labors." The Yellow Emperor asked: "How can they be treated?" Gao Yang Fu replied: "The Shi Wei pill is the main remedy for it."

Incomparable Yams Pill
Treats all deficiencies and numerous ailments.
Dosage: Two taels of yams, four taels of cistanche, six taels of schisandra, three taels each of dodder, eucommia, achyranthes, cornelian cherry, dried rehmannia, and alisma, five taels each of poria (or hoelen) and morinda root.

There are no dietary restrictions, except to avoid sour, garlicky, and rancid foods. After seven days, one will feel strong, the body will be moist, lips and mouth will be red, hands and feet warm, and the face radiant. It aids digestion and contributes to muscle growth, while also promoting bodily tranquility and clarity of voice—this is the evidence of its effectiveness. The medicine penetrates deeply, reaching the brain; thus, the nose may feel sour or sore, which should not be alarming. If seeking significant fat gain, add two taels of gypsum; for those with memory loss, add one tael of polygala; if the body is lacking moisture, add one tael of biota seeds.[191p]

　　八味肾气圆　治虚劳不足，大渴欲饮，腰痛，小腹拘急，小便不利。　　干地黄八两　山茱萸　薯蓣各四两　泽泻　牡丹皮　茯苓各三两　桂心　附子各二两　　右八味为末，蜜丸如梧子大，酒下十五丸，日三，加至二十五丸。
　　黄芪圆　治五劳七伤，诸虚不足，肾气虚损，目视(目巟)(目巟)，耳无所闻。　　黄芪　干姜　当归　羌活一作白朮　芎藭　甘草　茯苓　细辛　桂心　乌头　附子　干地黄　防风　人参　芍药　石斛　苁蓉各二两　枣膏五合　羊肾一具　　右十九味为末，以枣膏与蜜为丸如梧子大，酒服十五丸，日二，加至三十丸。一方，无芎藭、干姜、当归、羌活，止十五味。[193p]

Eight-Flavored Kidney Qi Pills: Treats deficiency labor and insufficiency, great thirst and desire to drink,腰 pain, urgency in the lower abdomen, and difficulty in urination. The ingredients include: 8 taels of dried rehmannia, 4 taels each of cornelian cherry and yam, 3 taels each of alisma, peony root, and poria, and 2 taels each of cinnamon heart and aconite. Grind the above eight ingredients into a fine powder, form small pills the size of a walnut, take 15 pills with wine, three times a day, increasing to 25 pills.

Huang Qi Pills: Treats five labors and seven injuries, various deficiencies and insufficiencies, damaged kidney qi, poor eyesight, and hearing loss. The ingredients include: 2 taels each of astragalus, dried ginger, angelica, white atractylodes, ligusticum, licorice, poria, chuanxiong, cinnamon heart, aconite, dried rehmannia, ledebouriella, ginseng, peony, dendrobium, and cistanche; 5 he of jujube paste and one sheep's kidney. Grind the above nineteen ingredients into a fine powder, combine with jujube paste and honey to form small pills the size of a walnut, take 15 pills with wine, twice a day, increasing to 30 pills. In one variation, without chuanxiong, dried ginger, angelica, or ligusticum, a total of 15 ingredients is used.[193p]

　　神化圆　治五劳七伤，气不足，阴下湿痒或生疮，小便数有余沥，阴头冷疼，失精自出，小腹急，绕脐痛，膝重不能久立，目视漠漠，见风泪出，胫酸，精气衰微，卧不欲起，手足厥冷，调中利食。　　苁蓉　牛膝　薯蓣各六分　续断　山茱萸　大黄各五分　远志　泽泻　天雄　柏子仁　菟丝子　人参　防风　石斛　(艹舌)蒌根　杜仲　黄连　白朮　甘草　礜石　当归各一两　桂心　石南　干姜　蛇床子　赤石脂　萆薢　茯苓　细辛　菖蒲　芎藭各三分　　右三十一味为末，蜜丸如梧子，酒服五丸，日三，加至二十丸。[194p]

Shenhua Yuan

To treat the five wearinesses and seven injuries, with insufficient qi, dampness and itching below, or sores, frequent and excessive urination, cold pain in the genitals, spontaneous emission of essence, urgency in the lower abdomen, pain around the navel, heaviness in the knees making it hard to stand for long, blurred vision with tears in the wind, sore shins, weak essence, reluctance to get up from lying down, coldness in hands and feet, regulate digestion and benefit appetite.

Ingredients:
6 parts of Cistanche, Achyranthes, Dioscorea;
5 parts of Dipsacus, Cornus, Rhubarb;
1 liang each of Polygala, Alisma, Chuanwu, Biota seed, Cuscuta seed, Ginseng, Fangfeng, Dendrobium, Smilax, Eucommia, Berberine, Atractylodes, Licorice, Lapis lazuli, Angelica;
3 parts of Cinnamon, Jue Ming Zi, Dried Ginger, Cnidium seed, Red resin, Bletilla, Poria, Xixin, Calamus, Ligusticum.

Mix the thirty-one ingredients into a powder, form into honey pills the size of a jujube, take five pills with wine, three times a day, increasing up to twenty pills.[194p]

　　三仁九子圆　治五劳七伤，补益。

　　通明圆　治五劳七伤六极，强力行事，举重；重病后，骨髓未满，房室；所食不消，胃气不平。　　麦门冬三斤　干地黄　石苇各一斤　紫菀　五味子　肉苁蓉　甘草　阿胶　杜仲　远志　茯苓　天雄各半斤　　右十二味为末，蜜丸如梧子，食前，苦酒服十丸，日再，加至二十丸。[195p]

Three nuts and nine seeds formula: Treats the five labors and seven injuries, replenishing and benefiting.
Sour jujube seed, cedar seed, coix seed, dodder seed, chrysanthemum seed, goji berry seed, cnidium seed, ground cassia seed, earth skin seed, black sesame seed, missing one seed, rehmannia, yam, and cassia heart, each two taels; epimedium three taels. The above sixteen ingredients are ground into a powder, made into honey pills the size of a walnut, taken with wine: twenty pills, twice a day and once at night.

Bone-filling formula: Treats the five labors, seven injuries, replenishes the five organs, and eliminates myriad diseases.
Dendrobium, ginseng, angelica, musk, stone long-life, stone reed, white atractylodes, distant wisdom, epimedium, morinda, purple aster, poria, dried ginger, tian xiong, cnidium seed, achyranthes, oyster, aconite, red peony, cedar seed, licorice, yam, ejiao, dried rehmannia, and schisandra, each two taels; sichuan pepper three taels. The above twenty-six ingredients are ground into a powder, made into honey pills the size of a walnut, taken with wine: three pills, three times a day.

Clearing brightness formula: Treats the five labors, seven injuries, and six extremes; strengthens vitality for heavy tasks and lifting; after severe illness when the bone marrow is not full, pelvic issues; indigestible food and unbalanced stomach qi.
Mai men dong three jin, dried rehmannia and stone reed each one jin; purple aster, schisandra, meat epimedium, licorice, ejiao, eucommia, distant wisdom, poria, tian xiong, each half jin. The above twelve ingredients are ground into a powder, made into honey pills the size of a walnut, taken before meals with bitter wine: ten pills, twice a day, increasing to twenty pills.[195p]

　　补虚益精大通圆　治五劳七伤百病。　　干地黄八两　干姜　当归　石斛　肉苁蓉　天门冬　白朮　甘草　芍药　人参各六两　麻子仁半两　紫菀茸　大黄　黄芩各五两　蜀椒三升　防风四两　茯苓　杏仁各三两　白芷一两　　右十九味为末，白蜜枣膏丸如弹子，空腹服一丸，日二，服十日效。
　　干地黄圆　治五劳七伤六极，脏腑虚弱，饮食不下，颜色黧黯，八风所伤，补虚益气，进食，资颜色，长阳。　　干地黄　茯苓　天雄各七分　蛇床子六分　桂心　麦门冬各五分　远志　苁蓉　杜仲　甘草各十分　五味子四分　阿胶　枣肉各八分　　右十三味为末，蜜丸如梧子，酒下二十丸，日再，加至三十丸，常服弥佳。[196p]

Supplementing deficiency and benefiting essence, this is a comprehensive remedy for the five labors and seven injuries, as well as various ailments. The ingredients are:

  • 8 taels of dried rehmannia
  • Dried ginger
  • Angelica
  • Dendrobium
  • Cistanche
  • Asparagus
  • Atractylodes
  • Licorice
  • Peony
  • Ginseng, each 6 taels
  • Flaxseed, half a tael
  • Purple aster mushroom
  • Rhubarb
  • Huangqin, each 5 taels
  • Sichuan pepper, 3 sheng
  • Fangfeng, 4 taels
  • Poria and almond, each 3 taels
  • White atractylodes, 1 tael

The above nineteen ingredients are powdered. Mix with white honey to form pills the size of a bullet. Take one pill on an empty stomach, twice a day, for ten days to see effects.

Dried rehmannia pills treat the five labors, seven injuries, and internal weaknesses due to deficiency. Symptoms include poor appetite, dark complexion, injuries from the eight winds; they supplement the deficiency, boost energy, improve appetite, enhance complexion, and promote vitality. The ingredients are:

  • 7 parts dried rehmannia
  • Poria, Tianxiong, each 7 parts
  • Cnidium fruit, 6 parts
  • Cinnamon bark, Asparagus, each 5 parts
  • Yuanzi, Cistanche, Du Zhong, Licorice, each 10 parts
  • Schisandra, 4 parts
  • Ejiao, jujube flesh, each 8 parts

The above thirteen ingredients are powdered. Mix into honey pills the size of a walnut. Take twenty pills with wine, twice a day, and gradually increase to thirty pills. Regular consumption leads to better effects.[196p]

　　崔平世方　治五劳七伤。
　　锺乳粉　萆薢各一分　巴戟天二分　菟丝子　苁蓉各二分　干姜三分。一作干地黄　　右六味为末，蜜丸如梧子，酒服七丸，日三。服讫，行百步；服酒三合，行三百步。胸中热定，即食干饭，牛羊兔肉任为羹，去肥腻，余不忌。
　　石英煎　治男子女人五劳七伤，消枯羸瘦，风虚痼冷，少气力，无颜色，不能动作，口苦咽燥，眠中不安，恶梦惊惧百病。　　白石英碎如米，以醇酒九升，铜器中微火煎取三升，以竹蓖搅勿住手，去滓澄清　紫石英制法同上　干地黄各一斤　白蜜三斤　石斛五两　酥桃仁各三升　柏子仁　远志　茯苓　山茱萸　人参　麦门冬　桂心　五味子　干姜　白朮　苁蓉　甘草　天雄　白芷　细辛　芎藭　黄芪　防风　薯蓣各二两　　右二十四味，治下筛，内煎中，如不足加酒，取足为限，煎令可丸，如梧子大，酒服二十丸，日三，稍加至四十丸为度。无药者，可单服煎，令人肥白充实。[197p]

Cui Pingshi's method treats the five labors and seven injuries.

For the formula: one part of Zhongru powder, one part of Bixie, two parts of Bajitian, two parts of Tusizi, two parts of Congrong, and three parts of dried ginger. (Some texts say dried Rehmannia instead of dried ginger.) Grind these six ingredients into a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of a walnut. Take seven pills with wine, three times a day. After taking, walk a hundred steps; after taking the wine three times, walk three hundred steps. If the heat in the chest is settled, then eat plain rice, and meat from cows, sheep, or rabbits is permissible, avoiding fatty or greasy foods; otherwise, there are no restrictions.

For the Shiying decoction: it treats the five labors and seven injuries in both men and women, dissipates withering and emaciation, addresses wind deficiency, coldness, lack of strength, pale complexion, inability to act, bitter mouth and dry throat, restlessness during sleep, nightmares, fright, and numerous ailments.

Crush white quartz into rice-sized pieces, use nine sheng of pure wine, simmer in a copper vessel over low heat to extract three sheng. While stirring continuously with a bamboo spatula, remove the residue and clarify. The method for purple quartz is the same as above.

For the following ingredients, each uses one jin of dried Rehmannia, three jin of white honey, five liang of Dendrobium, three sheng each of peach kernel and cedar nuts, as well as yuan zhi, poria, shan zhu yu, ginseng, mai men dong, cinnamon heart, five-flavor fruit, dried ginger, bai zhu, cong rong, licorice, tian xiong, bai zhi, xi xin, xuang ru, huang qi, fang feng, and shan yao—two liang of each.

Mix these twenty-four ingredients, filter them, and if insufficient, add wine to a sufficient level; simmer until they can be rolled into pills the size of walnuts. Take twenty pills with wine, three times a day, gradually increasing to forty pills as the standard. If there are no ingredients, one may take the decoction alone, which helps in becoming plump, fair, and robust.[197p]

Collection of Classical and Modern Texts: Complete Medical Volume 306

Section on Consumption

Formulas

Earth Immortal Powder (from "Treatment for Life Preservation") - Treats bone fever and muscle heat, alleviates all forms of consumption and agitation, generates bodily fluids. Ingredients: 2 taels of Rehmannia root, 1 tael of Saposhnikovia, 0.5 taels of roasted Licorice. Preparation: Grind the above ingredients, take 4 qians, with 1.5 cups of water and 5 slices of ginger, boil down to 80%, strain, and take warm, without fixed timing.

Four Gentlemen Decoction (from Hejian, same as above) - Treats lung damage leading to skin and hair loss, boosts Qi. Ingredients: equal parts of Atractylodes, Ginseng, Astragalus, and Poria.[198p]

　　右为粗末，每服五六七钱，水一盏，煎至七分，去滓，食远温服。
　　八物汤　治心肺虚损，皮聚而毛落，血脉虚损。　　白朮　人参　黄芪　茯苓　川芎　熟地黄　当归　芍药各等分　　右粗末，服五七钱，水一盏，煎七分，去滓，食后温服。
　　千金散　治心肺损及胃，饮食不为肌肤，宜和气血，调饮食。　　白朮　人参　黄芪　茯神　桂枝　熟地黄　当归　川芎　芍药　甘草等分　　右为末，加生姜枣同煎，水一大盏，药五钱，煎至七分，食前，日三服。

The following is a translation of the provided Classical Chinese text:

The above is a coarse powder. For each dose, take five to seven qians, mix with a cup of water, boil until reduced by seven-tenths, strain, and take while warm after meals.

Eight Ingredients Decoction: Treats deficiency of the heart and lungs, leads to skin gathering and hair loss, and nourishes the blood vessels. Ingredients include equal parts of: Atractylodes, Ginseng, Astragalus, Poria, Chuanxiong, Rehmannia, Angelica, and Peony. For each dose, take five to seven qians, mix with a cup of water, boil until reduced by seven-tenths, strain, and take warm after meals.

Thousand Gold Powder: Treats damage to the heart and lung and the stomach, when the diet is not nourishing the skin; it is suitable for harmonizing qi and blood and regulating diet. Ingredients include equal parts of: Atractylodes, Ginseng, Astragalus, Poria, Cinnamon Twig, Rehmannia, Angelica, Chuanxiong, Peony, and Licorice. Grind to powder, add ginger and jujube, boil together with one large cup of water and five qians of herbs until reduced by seven-tenths, and take before meals, three times a day.

Vajra Pill: Treats kidney damage and bone atrophy, when one cannot rise from bed, suitable for replenishing essence. Ingredients include equal parts of: Cistanche soaked in wine, Chinese Dodder soaked in wine, Eucommia bark (stems removed), and Rhizoma Wulingshan. Grind to a fine powder, boil with pig kidneys to make pills, taking five to seventy pills per dose on an empty stomach with wine.

Niu Posture Pill: Treats kidney and liver damage, bone atrophy, when one cannot rise from bed, and the tendons are weak and cannot hold; it is suitable for replenishing essence and easing the body. Ingredients include equal parts of: Niu Posture soaked in wine, Rhizoma Wulingshan, Eucommia bark (stems removed), Cistanche soaked in wine, Fangfeng, Chinese Dodder soaked in wine, and Tribulus. Reduce the amount of Cinnamon Twig by half. Grind to fine powder, boil with pig kidneys, and make pills the size of tung seed, taking five to seventy pills on an empty stomach with wine.[199p]

　　煨肾丸　治肾肝损及脾损，谷不化，宜益精缓中消谷。　　牛膝酒浸　萆薢　杜仲　肉苁蓉　菟丝子　防风　白蒺藜　胡卢巴　故纸各等分　桂半钱　　右，和剂服饵如金刚丸法，腰痛不起者甚效。
　　黑地黄丸　加五味子名肾气丸。治阳盛阴虚，脾肾不足，房室虚损，形瘦无力，面色青黄无常，宜此养血益肾。　　苍朮米泔浸　熟地黄各一斤　五味子半斤　川姜冬一两，夏五钱，春七钱　　右为细末，枣肉为丸如梧子大，每服一百丸至二百丸，食前，米饮或酒下。
　　金明散 【《紫庭方》，下同】 　补肝脏劳极。　　人参　知母　茯苓　秦艽　丁香　甘草炙　石膏煅，各等分　　右件为细末，每服二分，水一盏，葱白三寸，同煎至八分，通口服之。
　　守灵散　补心脏劳极。

Yao Shen Wan: Treats damage to the kidneys, liver, and spleen, aiding in the digestion of grains and replenishing essence to alleviate symptoms. Ingredients: prepared cow knee soaked in wine, rhizoma dioscoreae, eucommia bark, cistanche, dodder, saposhnikovia, white spiny thistle, and caltrop, each in equal parts, along with half a coin of cinnamon. Mix and take as pills, similar to the method for Jin Gang Wan; it is very effective for severe腰痛.

He Di Huang Wan (also known as Shen Qi Wan): Added with Schisandra, it treats Yang excess and Yin deficiency, inadequate spleen and kidney function, and weakness from sexual activity, characterized by thinness and irregular facial coloration. Ingredients: bitter rice soaked in water, prepared rehmannia, each one pound; half a pound of schisandra; winter ginger one tael, summer five qian, spring seven qian. Grind these into a fine powder, make pills the size of a walnut, and take one hundred to two hundred pills before meals, with rice drink or wine.

Jin Ming San (from the "Zi Ting Fang", same below): Nourishes the liver in cases of extreme fatigue. Ingredients: ginseng, anemarrhena, poria, gentian, clove, and honey-fried licorice, each in equal amounts. Grind into a fine powder; take two fen with one cup of water, add three inches of green onion, and boil until reduced to eight parts, then consume.

Shou Ling San: Nourishes the heart in cases of extreme fatigue. Ingredients: white poria, clove, and terminalia each one tael; platycodon, peony, qinghao, and honey-fried licorice each one fen. Grind into a fine powder; take two qian with one cup of water, add a piece of silver ear fungus and three inches of green onion, boil until reduced to eight parts, then consume.[200p]

Soul Stagnation Powder: Tonifies the spleen and alleviates extreme exhaustion.

  • White Yaozi

Wubiwán
Treats exhaustion from prolonged illness; taking it for up to a month leads to recovery. For other wasting diseases, take multiple doses for effect.
Ingredients:

  • Two liang of purple river car, boiled in vinegar and soaked overnight, then dried and ground into powder
  • Five qian each of peony, turtle shell (vinegar-baked), bitter gentian, gentian grass, yellow bellflower, anemarrhena, fritillary bulbus, rhinoceros horn shavings, autumn stone, fire-roasted soybeans, curcuma, and glauber salt
  • Two fen of each of the above, along with balloon flower, Coptis chinensis, rhubarb, and honey-roasted licorice
    Mix into a fine powder, form into pills the size of a wutong seed, taking twenty pills with warm wine. If there is heat in the intestines, take before meals; if there is heat in the diaphragm, take after meals.

Duoming San
Ingredients:

  • One liang each of turtle shell (vinegar-baked) and the heavenly spirit cover (soaked in vinegar overnight, then baked with fat until golden)
  • Thirty-seven pieces of peach kernels, skin removed and wheat bran fried
  • Five qian each of licorice and ginseng
  • One liang each of bupleurum (with the stems removed), anemarrhena, and qinghao, along with a handful of green onion white and four pieces of asafoetida
    Grind turtle shell and heavenly spirit cover into powder, then add ground ginseng, anemarrhena, bupleurum, and licorice, mixing well. Then add qinghao, peach kernels, green onion white, and crushed asafoetida, forming into a cake. Bake slowly until dry, measuring two qian. Use two cups of children's urine, boil to one cup, strain, and expose to the stars overnight until the fifth watch at three points. Take half a cup hot, then wrap and lie down until dawn, taking another half cup warm. Help the patient walk three to five steps, and for three days, do not wash face or hands, waiting for hair to grow on the head as evidence. Every morning, eat plain porridge to replenish.[202p]

Tian Zhu Huang Drink

Tian Zhu Huang, 1 two; Mai Men Dong, 1 two; Ren Shen, Fu Ling, Gan Cao, Fang Feng, Fu Shen, Sheng Di Huang, Yuan Zhi (remove heart), Xi Jiao shreds, Long Gu each 5 qian; Yan Hu Suo, Da Fu Zi each 7 pieces.

The above ingredients should be ground into a powder. Use 2.5 liters of water, decoct until reduced to 1 liter. Divide into three portions and take warm. Avoid all poisonous substances. For treating those who have been bedridden for a long time, first examine the color of the fingernails; if they are pale white, treatment is possible; if they are purple-black, it is difficult to treat.

She Xiang Powder

For treating women and young girls with accumulated heat, internal bloating, bone steaming, irregular menstrual flow, and those with thin, laboring, hot muscles.

Weiling Xian, 4 liang, ground into fine powder; Ganqi, 1 liang, crushed and roasted until the smoke disappears; Xiong Huang, 1 fen; She Xiang, 1 fen, ground separately.

Mix together to form a powder, and use steamed cake paste to make pills the size of a walnut. Take 15 to 20 pills each time, with tea soup as desired, followed by taking Tao Ren Powder.

Tao Ren Powder

Peel and tip off the peach seeds, then roast them until yellow; Chi Fu Ling, 1 liang; Ren Shen, Bai Shao, Chen Pi each 3 fen; Xi Jiao, An Xiang each 1 fen; She Xiang, 2 qian; Bing Lang, 4 pieces.

Grind all into a powder. Take 2 qian each time, along with 5 slices of ginger and 1 cup of water, decoct until reduced to 6 portions. Take before meals in the morning and evening. If a worm head appears red, take Tian Zhu Huang Drink immediately to protect the heart. If the worm has not been removed, one must still first protect the heart and take the remedy.[203p]

Chai Hu San treats the bone steaming heat in children and alleviates the muscle heat after recovering from a cold. The ingredients are: three taels of processed tortoise shell, one tael each of Chai Hu, Da Huang, dry lacquer fried, Qin Jiao, Gan Cao, and Chang Shan. Grind them together. For each dose, take one qian, add to one zhong of water with a pinch of wheat, and simmer until reduced to seven parts. Strain and take cold.

For taking insect medication:
One woodpecker, four taels each of cinnabar and finely minced pig meat.

Observe if the woodpecker is very hungry, mix the cinnabar into the minced meat to ensure it eats all. If there are no live ones, a dead one can be used as well. Place the bird in a jar, seal with salt clay, and dry it overnight with a strong fire. The next day, after it has seen no sunlight, take it out and grind it into a fine powder in a silver container, mixing it with some clear alcohol for one dose, adding a little musk. Place the patient in a closed tent, tightly sealed, using iron tongs to wait for the insects to come out of the patient's mouth. Once they do, immediately take the insect and fry it in boiling oil to eliminate it completely. Prepare strong boiling oil nearby for the patient's vicinity.

After the insects emerge, it is advisable to take Jia He San. If you took it the previous night, also have porridge. Recite this incantation: "Om Ah Wu (Kou Fei) Hung Hung Chi."[204p]

Fishing for Worms Pill
One and five-tenths taels of magnetic stone, ground to a fine powder if tightly packed. One tael of Nansha (a type of mineral). One-tenth of a tael of musk. The greasy powder is ground separately. Five-tenths of a tael each of dragon bone. All are ground together into a powder, made into pills the size of cherries using wax. Each time, take one pill and use a needle to pierce a small hole in it, threading it with blue and red thread, tying a large ancient coin at the end. In the morning, have the patient sit straight and swallow it with warm water, waiting for the medicine to go down their throat, then close their mouth and bite the ancient coin with their teeth, waiting for nausea to bring it up. The shape of the worms varies; they must be quickly killed with hot oil. If they do not come up, but only blood or saliva is expelled, the illness is also cured. After that, take the usual harmonizing and regulating medicines for two to three days, which is even better. This treatment can be used on two or more patients with warm water baths. If it is a case of corpse-loathe, one pill can save two people.

Divine Efficacy for Worms Powder

Two-tenths of a tael of sulfur. All are ground to a powder and made into pills the size of mung beans using wax. Each time, take one pill, tie a scarlet thread measuring twelve feet long around it, wrap the pill with a little ice cream, and cover it with a section of silkworm cocoon threaded onto the line. Have the patient eat the ice cream first, then swallow the pill the next day. After a while, when the line moves, pull it out firmly; if there are worms, kill them in boiling oil. This medicine should be prepared on the day before the Dragon Boat Festival and consumed in the morning. Initially, take paper pills, then use the secret method of the immortals to gather them.[205p]

For physicians treating cadaveric transmission, one must first fast and concentrate the mind, offering incense to the sacred before taking the paper pills. Chicken eggs should be coated with paper and dried, then cut into the size of coins to be consumed, followed by taking the previous pills.

Divine Communication Powder
Treats cadaveric exhaustion.
One piece of Aconite, one tael of Rhubarb, two characters of Cattle Bile, all ground to powder. Add seven handfuls each of peach and willow branches, and Qinghao, crushed finely. Soak in half a bowl of childhood urine overnight. The next day at dawn, boil it for several times, filter out the residue, mix in half of the powder, consume it, and then sleep covered by clothes and blankets to expel any malevolent substances that may surface, without needing to stop diarrhea. When it’s time to remove the expelled matter, use a basin to catch it; the matter may resemble horsehair, tangled strands, centipedes, chicken eggs, or like torn cotton fluff. It is important to have someone assist once this is achieved. Avoid hard substances, tea, roasted duck, crab, raw cold greasy foods, pickles, etc. Afterward, take: licorice, Huanglian, Angelica, and Mu Xiang each five qian, mix with two sheng of wine, prepare in earthenware until reduced to five xiao, pour out, then boil these four ingredients, reduce to soft and thick, and form into pills the size of Wutong seeds. Take them with either wine or salty broth, thirty pills at a time, for immediate effect.[206p]

The Purple River Vehicle pill treats flying corpses, ghosts, and ailments causing weakness and coughing. For a man's first child, take a corpse and clean it with water from the sauropus fruit. Wash it with rice vinegar, drain it, and place it in a small drying basket, tightly wrapping it with paper to prevent heat from escaping. Place the vehicle on top and heat it over a strong fire, then cover it to ensure it dries thoroughly.

For the subsequent medicinal ingredients, prepare one and a half taels of ginseng, one tael each of white atractylodes, white poria, and poria cocos, one tael each of angelica and prepared rhubarb, and five qian of wood fragrance. Form it into pills about the size of a tung seed, taking fifty pills each time, washing down with a broth of ginseng. Take it on an empty stomach at noon and again later; alternatively, it can also be made into pills with honey.[207p]

Mingmu Dan treats the symptoms of transmitted corpse fatigue and expels corpse insects.

On a Mid-Autumn night, collect forty-nine grains of moon sand and one qian of wild field sand. Grind them into a fine powder, then mix with honey to form pills the size of a tung seed, taking seven pills each time. Use five qian of fresh licorice, crushed, and extract concentrated juice with one cup of water. If the patient is thin, use roasted licorice and take it on an empty stomach at dawn. Warn the patient against agitation. Cold administration is permissible. If there’s slight relief after two days, take it again to expel the insects; use the lower dosage in the upper week.

Qinghao drink specifically treats fatigue diseases.

For Qinghao with red roots, take one sheng of the seeds, five liang of leaves, and dry three liang of tender peach and tender willow branches each, two liang of earth bone skin, one liang each of licorice, Chaihu, and gardenia seeds. Adjust according to the patient’s condition. Grind all the ingredients, and take three qian with one cup of water and two black plums, cooking down to seven parts. Take it at any time.

Chaihu powder supplements for fatigue.

The ingredients are Chaihu, ginseng, white poria, platycodon, white peony, chuanxiong, and Chinese angelica soaked in wine overnight; Qingpi, Mai Dong, Shengma, mulberry bark, and white atractylodes soaked in water overnight, then sun-dried and roasted, along with one liang of licorice. Grind them into a powder, and take one cup of water boiled down to seven parts, to be taken orally.[208p]

Baked Turtle Shell Decoction to Nourish the Weak
One piece of turtle shell, toasted until yellow; Chaihu, Danggui, and prepared licorice, each one liang; Platycodon, red peony, and ginseng, each one liang; peeled apricot kernels stir-fried, Xuan huanglian, Hu huanglian, and Dihupi, each one fen; Mu xiang and guangui without coarse skin, uncooked, each five qian; musk, true suya, and white honey, each three liang.

Grind into a fine powder, use one jin of qinghao and five sheng of boys’ urine, boil down the qinghao juice to about two sheng, strain out the dregs, combine with suya and honey, boil down into a paste. Once cooled, add the powdered herbs, mix well into pills the size of tung seeds. Take fifteen pills each time, down with warm wine, rice drink is also acceptable, three times daily. In autumn and winter, additionally add seven peach and willow hearts, decoct and take with the previous Chaihu powder.

Guan Zhong Pills to Expel the Three Corpses and Five Worms
Guan zhong and wuyi, each five fen; Bai guolao, xionghuang, Shuqi, and houpu, each three fen; wolf teeth and dried silkworms, each four fen; thunder pill, six fen. Select clean and dry, fry until yellow, grind into a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of tung seeds. Take five pills with a long stream of water, three times, increasing gradually to ten or twenty pills. After twenty days of taking, all illnesses will be cured, and the three corpses and nine worms will be eliminated. Those taking it must fast and be respectful. Women who have not conceived will bear children upon taking it.[209p]

　　雄黄丸　专祛三尸九虫。

　　右镕脂为丸如莲子大，平旦服一丸，服之七日，三尸九虫尽去。
　　轻咳散　治劳嗽。
　　乌梅　龙胆草　胡黄连　贝母　知母　桔梗　鳖甲酢炙　甘草炙　秦艽　柴胡　青蒿酒煮　人参　山栀仁　阿胶炒珠　杏仁去皮尖麸炒　　右件晒干为末，用好京墨一寸，以井华水磨调前药末，作饼子如大指头大，透风处阴干二七日，方用。每服一饼，井水磨化，又用没药五分，磨水一盏，于五更又用黄皮末二钱，同煎数沸，却入盏内，频频打转，通口，于五更时，轻轻起，吃就仰卧，甚者不过三服。
　　蛤蚧散　专治劳嗽。[210p]

Gui Xin Wan: This remedy removes the three corpses and the nine worms. Use three taels of熟地黄 (shú dì huáng) and five qian of干漆 (gān qī), stir-fried with one tael of 桂心 (guì xīn) to make a fine powder. Shape this powder into pills the size of a wutong seed. Take seven pills with rice wine.

Xiong Huang Wan: This is specifically for expelling the three corpses and the nine worms. Grind one tael of雄黄 (xióng huáng) and one tael of松脂 (sōng zhī) to mix them into a paste. Form this into pills the size of lotus seeds. Take one pill at dawn for seven days until the three corpses and nine worms are completely eradicated.

Qing Ke San: This treats chronic cough. Combine the following herbs: 乌梅 (wū méi), 龙胆草 (lóng dǎn cǎo), 胡黄连 (hú huáng lián), 贝母 (bèi mǔ), 知母 (zhī mǔ), 桔梗 (jué gěng), 鳖甲 (biē jiǎ) that has been vinegar-processed, 炙甘草 (zhì gān cǎo), 秦艽 (qín jiáo), 柴胡 (chái hú), 青蒿 (qīng hāo) boiled in wine, 人参 (rén shēn), 山栀仁 (shān zhī rén), 炒珠阿胶 (chǎo zhū ā jiāo), and 杏仁去皮尖 (xìng rén qù pí jiān) stir-fried. Dry these ingredients and grind them into a powder. Use one inch of high-quality Beijing ink, mixing it with well water to adjust the herbal powder into dough balls the size of a thumb. Dry these in a well-ventilated place for 14 days. When used, take one dough ball, dissolve it in well water, and also take five fen of没药 (mò yào) ground with a cup of water. At dawn, add two qian of黄皮 (huáng pí) powder, simmer it several times, then pour it into the cup. Stir frequently until mixed thoroughly. At dawn, gently rise and consume while lying on your back, not exceeding three doses if severe.

Ge Ge San: This is specifically for treating chronic cough.[210p]

　　人参酥酢刷炙令黄　白茯苓各一两，慢火炒燥　杏仁六两，去皮尖并双仁，隔纸炒干，捣粉出油尽　蛤蚧雌雄一对，入酥内浸透，慢火炙干，再用酥酢刷炙令黄熟，不得烧损　知母酥酢刷炙令黄　贝母酥酢刷炙令黄　桑皮酥酢刷炙令黄紫，各二两　甘草三两，捶碎，用酥酢刷炙紫黄　乳酥真好者五两，切作骰子块，入铫内镕成汁，入陈米酢半升，和匀同刷炙前药。酢不宜多用，只以四合多为的。庶好刷用，否则稀矣　　右件为末，每服二钱，水一盏，煎至七分服。忌油腻生冷毒物。如久患嗽者，初服此药，其嗽加甚，须勤服，久则可安，须自保惜为妙。　　又方　治劳热，疗肺损，止咳嗽。
