　　又方[211p]

Ginseng and fat roasted with vinegar until yellow; white Poria, each one tael, stir-fried over a slow fire until dry; six taels of almonds, remove the skin and tips, and the double kernels, fry dry with paper, pound into powder until the oil is extracted; one pair of male and female gecko, soak in the fat until saturated, then slowly roast dry, brush again with fat and vinegar until yellow and cooked, taking care not to burn; frigid motherwort brushed and roasted until yellow; fritillary brushed and roasted until yellow; mulberry bark brushed and roasted until yellow and purple, each two taels; three taels of liquorice, crushed, brushed and roasted until purple and yellow; five taels of pure milk fat, cut into dice, melt in a pan, add half a liter of aged rice vinegar, mix evenly with the previously brushed medicinal ingredients. The vinegar should not be used excessively; four parts is the maximum to ensure proper brushing; otherwise, it will become thin.

The above is a powder to be taken, two qian each time, with one cup of water, boil until reduced to seven parts to take. Avoid greasy, raw, or poisonous substances. If there is a long-standing cough, taking this medicine initially may worsen the cough; it should be used frequently, and in time, it will settle down. One must take care and be cautious.

Another formula treats fatigue heat, heals lung damage, and stops coughing. One pair of geckos, cleaned, roasted with wine vinegar; Huangqin (Scutellaria), liquorice, Coptis, Qinjiao, liquorice, Shengdihuang (raw rehmannia), cooked Rehmannia, roasted ginseng, Chaihu (Bupleurum), Mahuang (ephedra), Zhimu (Anemarrhena), peeled almonds, Fritillary without heart, and Qinghao (sweet wormwood), each five qian; Bletilla, Mukang (Radix Saussureae), and Gentian, each one fen; one tael of turtle shell, roasted with wine vinegar.

The above are to be made into a fine powder and taken with a decoction of Wu Mei, ginger, and dates.

　　杏仁一斤　嫩生姜六两，切　人参四两　　右銼碎，入新沙锅内，用无根水一斗，烧木炭，以文武火熬，水尽为度，去生姜参渣放冷，每服杏仁五七个，频频服之。
　　五蒸汤 【《古今录验》】
　　茯苓　甘草　人参　竹叶　生地黄　葛根　知母　黄芩　石膏　粳米二合　　右(口父)咀，以水三盏，煎小麦二合至二盏，去麦煎药至一盏，温服，随证加减于后。忌海藻菘菜芜荑酢。实热加黄芩、黄连、黄蘗、大黄。虚热，气加乌梅、秦艽、柴胡，血加青蒿、鳖甲、蛤蚧、小麦、牡丹皮。肺蒸，鼻干，加乌梅、天冬、麦冬、紫菀。大肠蒸，右鼻孔干痛，加大黄、芒硝。皮蒸，舌白唾血，加石膏、桑白皮。肤蒸，昏昧嗜卧，加丹皮。气蒸，鼻干喘促，遍身气热，加人参、黄芩、山栀。心蒸，舌干，加黄连、生地。小肠蒸，下唇焦，加赤茯苓、生地、木通。血蒸，发焦，加生地、当归、桂心、童便。脉蒸，唾白浪语，脉络溢脉缓急不调，加当归、生地。[212p]

Almonds, one pound; tender ginger, six ounces, cut; ginseng, four ounces, ground. Add these to a new sand pot, using one斗 of water, and burn charcoal with both gentle and strong heat, simmering until the water is reduced. Remove the ginger and ginseng residue and let it cool. Take five to seven almonds at each dose, and take it frequently.

Five-Steamed Soup [from "Records of Ancient and Modern Efficacy"]
Poria, licorice, ginseng, bamboo leaves, raw rehmannia, kudzu root, Anemarrhena, scutellaria, gypsum, and two sheng of glutinous rice. Prepare these by grinding them, using three cups of water, and boil two sheng of wheat until reduced to two cups. Afterward, strain out the wheat and boil the medicine down to one cup. Take warm, adjusting ingredients based on symptoms. Avoid seaweed, vegetables, and vinegar. For excess heat, add scutellaria, coptis, berberine, or rhubarb. For deficiency heat, if due to qi, add ume, qinjiao, or bupleurum; if due to blood, add qinghao, turtle shell, gecko, wheat, or peony root. For lung steaming with dry nose, add ume, aspidistra, wheat, or purple aster. For large intestine steaming with dry, painful right nostril, add rhubarb or mirabilite. For skin steaming with white tongue and bloody saliva, add gypsum or mulberry bark. For fatigue and lethargy with a desire to sleep, add peony root. For qi steaming with dry nose and shortness of breath, add ginseng, scutellaria, or gardenia. For heart steaming with dry tongue, add coptis or raw rehmannia. For small intestine steaming with dry lower lip, add red poria, raw rehmannia, or akebia. For blood steaming, indicated by burning sensation, add raw rehmannia, angelica, cinnamon, or infant urine. For pulse steaming, indicated by white saliva and irregular pulse, add angelica or raw rehmannia.[212p]

脾蒸，唇焦，加白芍、木瓜、苦参。胃蒸，舌下痛，加石膏、粳米、大黄、芒硝、干葛。肉蒸，食无味而呕，烦躁不安，加白芍。肝蒸，眼黑，加川芎、当归、柴胡。胆蒸，眼白失色，加柴胡、(艹舌)蒌。筋蒸，甲焦，加当归、川芎。三焦蒸，乍热乍寒，加石膏、竹叶。肾蒸，两耳焦，加生地、石膏、知母、寒水石。膀胱蒸，右耳焦，加泽泻、茯苓、滑石。脑蒸，头眩热闷，加生地、防风、羌活。髓蒸，髓枯骨中热，加生地、当归、天门冬。骨蒸，齿黑腰痛足逆冷，疳虫食脏，加鳖甲、地骨皮、丹皮、生地、当归。臀蒸，肢细趺肿，腑脏皆热，加石膏、黄蘗。胞蒸，小便赤黄，加泽泻、茯苓、生地、沉香、滑石。凡此诸证，皆热病后，食肥甘油腻房事饮酒犯之而成。久蒸不除，变成疳病，死期近矣。[213p]

Spleen steaming, with chapped lips, add白芍 (white peony),木瓜 (papaya), and苦参 (bitter shrub). Stomach steaming, with pain under the tongue, add石膏 (gypsum),粳米 (glutinous rice),大黄 (rhubarb),芒硝 (mirabilite), and干葛 (dried kudzu). Flesh steaming, with tasteless food and vomiting, restlessness, add白芍 (white peony). Liver steaming, with blackened eyes, add川芎 (Chuanxiong),当归 (Angelica), and柴胡 (Bupleurum). Gallbladder steaming, with whitened eyes, add柴胡 (Bupleurum) and蒌 (a type of herb). Tendon steaming, with swollen nails, add当归 (Angelica) and川芎 (Chuanxiong). Triple warmer steaming, alternating hot and cold, add石膏 (gypsum) and竹叶 (bamboo leaves). Kidney steaming, with chapped ears, add生地 (raw rehmannia),石膏 (gypsum),知母 (Anemarrhena), and寒水石 (cold water stone). Bladder steaming, with chapped right ear, add泽泻 (Alisma),茯苓 (Poria), and滑石 (talc). Brain steaming, with dizziness and hot discomfort, add生地 (raw rehmannia),防风 (Siler), and羌活 (Notopterygium). Marrow steaming, with dry marrow and bone heat, add生地 (raw rehmannia),当归 (Angelica), and天门冬 (Asparagus). Bone steaming, with black teeth, waist pain, and cold feet, combined with parasites damaging organs, add鳖甲 (tortoise shell),地骨皮 (reynoutria),丹皮 (Moutan),生地 (raw rehmannia), and当归 (Angelica). Buttock steaming, with thin limbs and swelling, and all the organs feeling hot, add石膏 (gypsum) and黄蘗 (Berberis). Cyst steaming, with red and yellow urine, add泽泻 (Alisma),茯苓 (Poria),生地 (raw rehmannia),沉香 (agarwood), and滑石 (talc). All these symptoms occur after febrile illnesses, due to indulgence in rich foods, sexual activities, and drinking. If steaming persists and is not alleviated, it transforms into malnutrition disease, and death is near.[213p]

　　鳖甲地黄汤 【《济生方》，下同】 　治热劳手足热，烦心怔忡。　　柴胡　当归酒浸　麦门冬　鳖甲酢炙　石斛　白朮　熟地黄酒浸焙　茯苓　秦艽各一两　人参　肉桂　甘草炙，各半两　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水一盏半，生姜五片，乌梅少许，煎至七分，去滓温服，不拘时候。此药专治热劳，其性差寒，脾胃快者方可服饵，虚甚多汗者勿服。
　　黄芪饮子　治诸虚劳气，四肢倦怠，骨节酸疼，潮热乏力，自汗怔忡，日渐黄瘦，胸膈痞塞，不思饮食，咳嗽痰多，甚则唾血。　　黄芪蜜炙，一两半　当归酒浸　石斛　地骨皮　人参　紫菀　桑皮　附子炮去皮脐　(艹款)冬花　鹿茸酒蒸，各一两　半夏制　甘草炙，各半两　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水一盏半，生姜七片，枣子一枚，煎至七分，去滓温服，不拘时候。此药温补荣卫，枯燥者不宜进此。唾血不止者，加阿胶、蒲黄各半两。[214p]

Bie Jia Di Huang Decoction
Treats heat exhaustion with heat in the hands and feet, restless heart and agitation.
Ingredients:

  • Chai Hu
  • Dang Gui soaked in wine
  • Mai Men Dong
  • Bie Jia, vinegar-baked
  • Shi Hu
  • Bai Zhu
  • Shuo Di Huang soaked in wine and baked
  • Fu Ling
  • Qin Jiao, each one liang.
  • Ren Shen
  • Rou Gui
  • Gan Cao, both half liang.

Preparation:
Mince the above ingredients. For each dose, take four qian (about 12 grams), with one and a half bowls of water, add five slices of fresh ginger and a small amount of black plum. Simmer until reduced to seven parts, strain and take warm, without regard to time. This medicine specifically treats heat exhaustion; its nature is somewhat cold, so only those with a strong spleen and stomach may take it. Those who are very deficient and sweat profusely should not take it.

Huang Qi Decoction
Treats various forms of deficiency, fatigue in the limbs, bone and joint pain, tidal fever, weakness, spontaneous sweating, restlessness, gradual yellowing and emaciation, chest oppression, loss of appetite, and a cough with abundant phlegm, severe cases may result in spitting blood.
Ingredients:

  • Huang Qi, honey-baked, one and a half liang
  • Dang Gui soaked in wine
  • Shi Hu
  • Di Gu Pi
  • Ren Shen
  • Zi Wan
  • Sang Pi
  • Fu Zi, processed and skinless
  • (Cao Kuan) Dong Hua
  • Lu Rong steamed in wine, each one liang.
  • Ban Xia processed
  • Gan Cao baked, both half liang.

Preparation:
Mince the above ingredients. For each dose, take four qian (about 12 grams) with one and a half bowls of water, add seven slices of fresh ginger and one jujube. Simmer until reduced to seven parts, strain and take warm, without regard to time. This medicine warms and supplements the nutrients and defenses; those who are dry and depleted should not take this. For unceasing blood spitting, add half liang each of Ejiao and Pu Huang.[214p]

　　蛤蚧圆　治积劳咳嗽，日久不瘥。
　　蛤蚧酥炙，一枚　皂角不蛀者，酥炙去皮子，两挺　杏仁童便浸一昼夜，去皮尖控干，蜜炒　(艹款)冬花　木香　天麻　半夏汤泡七次　熟地黄酒蒸焙　五味子各一两　丁香半两　　右为细末，炼蜜为圆如梧桐子大，每服十五圆，加至二十圆，食后生姜汤下。
　　太上混元丹　河车者，天地之先，阴阳之祖，乾坤之橐钥，铅汞之匡廓，胚胎将兆，九九数足，我则载而成之，故谓之河车，历验篇中名曰混沌皮，盖亦生天地阴阳之始，为七十二丹之首，高士垂慈，始开端绪。太上云：若欲长生，当修所生。人之所生，实资于此。所以成功灵应，非金石草木，夜露晓霜之比伦，修真之士，服之不辍，诚足以还本元，补益之道，得其真也。　　紫河车一具，用少妇首生男子者良。[215p]

Gecko paste treats persistent cough caused by overwork, which does not heal over time.

For the preparation, take one gecko, remove the skin after roasting it gently; then soak two ounces of apricot kernels in the urine of a young boy for a day, remove the skin and tip, and dry. Stir-fry with honey and add winter flowers, wood fragrance, and tianma, each soaked in half summer soup seven times. Also, steam roasted cooked angelica and wine, as well as five-flavor fruit, each weighing one tael, with half tael of clove. Grind all into a fine powder, mix with honey to form round pills the size of a large ginkgo nut. Take fifteen pills at a time, increasing to twenty, and consume them with ginger soup after meals.

The Supreme Ultimate Chaos Pill, or "River Cart," is the precursor of heaven and earth, the ancestor of yin and yang, the key to the universe, the expanse of lead and mercury, the embryo that signifies, reflecting a complete cycle. Thus, it is called "River Cart." In the Classic of Proven Experience, it is named "Chaos Skin," and indeed it represents the beginning of the creation of heaven and earth, yin and yang, being the foremost of the seventy-two pills. High sages show compassion, initiating vital practices. The Supreme says: If one wishes for longevity, they must cultivate what is generated. What nourishes human life is fundamentally drawn from this. Hence, the success of spiritual response cannot be compared to metals, stones, plants, night dew, or morning frost. True practitioners continuously consume it, making it sufficient to return to the original state, enhance their vitality, and attain its essence.

One complete purple river cart is beneficial when the firstborn is a male from a young woman's head.[215p]

脐带全者，于东流水洗断血脉，入麝香二钱在内，以线缝定，用生绢包裹，悬胎于沙瓮内，入无灰酒五升，慢火熬成膏　沉香别研　朱砂别研水飞，各一两　苁蓉酒浸　安息香酒熬去沙石　人参　乳香别研，各二两　白茯苓去皮，三两　　右为细末，入河车膏子，和药末，杵千百下，圆如梧桐子大，每服七十圆，空心温酒送下，沉香汤尤佳。详此丹以紫河车为主，但佐使之药太轻，无病人久服可以轻身延年，补损扶虚。乃若病重之人服之，却宜用增添之法也。男子真阳气衰，荣卫虚耗，腰背疼痛，自汗怔忡，痰多咳喘，梦遗白浊，潮热心烦，脚膝无力，宜于内加：鹿茸酒蒸、川巴戟、锺乳粉、阳起石火煅、附子炮去皮脐、黄芪各二两，龙骨、鹿角镑、桑寄生或以川续断代、　紫菀各一两。右依前法修制，和前药末，杵和前膏子为圆，汤使如前，或沉香汤下。[216p]

To prepare the cord with the complete structure, wash the blood vessels in flowing water from the east, place two qians of musk inside, sew it securely with thread, and wrap it in raw silk. Suspend the fetus in a clay urn, add five liters of unburnt wine, and simmer slowly until it turns into a paste. Separately grind the agarwood, and separately grind the cinnabar, diluted with water, both at one liang each. Soak the cistanche in wine, and simmer the benzoin to remove sand and stones. Use two liang each of ginseng and frankincense, and three liang of peeled white poria. The right side should be made into a fine powder; mix it with the river carmel paste and the powdered medicines, pestle together thousands of times until they form balls the size of Chinese parasol seeds. Each dose is seventy balls, taken down with warm wine on an empty stomach; an agarwood decoction is especially good. This elixir takes the purple river carmel as the main ingredient, but if the auxiliary herbs are too light, it can prolong life and strengthen the body for those without illness who take it for a long time. However, for those who are seriously ill, it is advisable to employ additional methods.

For men whose true Yang energy is weak, with diminished vitality, back pain, spontaneous sweating, palpitations, abundant phlegm with coughs, nocturnal emissions with turbid fluid, tidal heat and irritability, and weakness in the feet and knees, the following should be added internally: two liang each of deer antler soaked in wine, chuan ba jili, powdered goat's milk, yangqi stone fire calcined, peeled and processed aconite, and astragalus; one liang each of dragon bone, deer horn pound, mulberry parasite, or with chuan xuduan, and purple aster. The right side should be processed according to the previous method, mixed with the prior powdered medicines, and pestled into rounds as before, using the decoction as before, or taken with agarwood decoction.[216p]

　　经效阿胶圆　治劳嗽并嗽血唾血。
　　阿胶蛤粉炒　生地黄洗　山药銼炒　卷柏叶　大蓟根　五味子　鸡苏各一两　茯苓　人参　百部洗去心　远志去心，甘草水煮　防风去芦　麦门冬去心　柏子仁炒别研，各半两　　右为细末，炼蜜为圆如弹子大，每服一圆，细嚼，浓煎小麦汤或麦门冬汤咽下。[217p]

Jingxiao Ejiao Pills are used to treat exhaustion cough and coughing up blood.

The ingredients are: Ejiao, clam powder, stir-fried raw Rehmannia, grated yam, leaves of the volvariella mushroom, roots of great thistle, Schisandra berries, chickensu (Perilla frutescens), each weighing one tael; Poria, ginseng, hundred-part (Fritillaria), washed to remove the heart, distant will (Polygala), with the heart removed, licorice boiled in water; Siler is to be cleaned of its husk, and Ophiopogon, with the heart removed, and cedar seeds, stir-fried and individually ground, each at half a tael.

The ingredients are to be finely powdered, then mixed with honey to form pills the size of a marble. Each time, take one pill, chew finely, and swallow with a strong decoction of wheat or Ophiopogon soup.[217p]

　　花蕊石烧过存性，研如粉
　　右用童子小便一盏，煎酢调末三钱，极甚者五钱，食后服。如男子病则和酒一半，妇人病则和酢一半，处调药，立止，其瘀血化为黄水。服此药后，其人必疏懈，其病体却用后药而补。[219p]

Tai Ping Pill: For the treatment of chronic cough, pulmonary consumption, and lung congestion, it is advisable to dissolve and take this pill. 　　取传尸伏尸劳虫法
　　天灵盖十字解者，酥炙为末，三分　安息香　虎粪骨用酢炙，各半两。人骨马上，兽骨次之　鳖甲九肋大者，酢炙，一两　桃仁去皮尖，二钱半　麝香另研　槟榔一钱　青蒿梢六两　葱头一百二十根　童便半碗　桃柳东南枝如箸大，每七条各七寸　豉三百粒　枫叶二十一片　　右，先将青蒿、桃柳、枫叶、葱头，用水二官升，煎半干去渣，入天灵盖、虎粪骨、鳖甲、安息香，童便煎取汁，去渣，约有四五合，将槟榔、麝香研匀，调作一服，早晨空腹服，以被盖汗。恐汗内有细虫，以白纸拭之，投火中，须臾必下。如有虫，以大火焚之，弃流水中。所用药，勿令病者知之。半月后，气血复完，再进一服，依前法三次，无虫乃止。以美饮食调理，其病自愈。此方必有阿魏半钱。　　又方[223p]

Method for Collecting and Preserving Corpses and Insect Extermination

For the method involving the vertex of the head, dissolve the ingredients as follows:

  • Ten parts of powdered fried substance
  • Three parts of benzoin
  • Equal parts (half-tael each) of tiger dung and bones

Use human bones in the primary instance, followed by animal bones. For large turtle shell ribs, one tael, also prepared with frying.

  • Two and a half qian of peeled peach kernels
  • Separate ground musk
  • One qian of areca nut
  • Six taels of young wormwood tips
  • One hundred and twenty scallions
  • Half a bowl of child's urine
  • For branches of peach and willow, sized like chopsticks, seven pieces each measuring seven inches
  • Three hundred fermented soybeans
  • Twenty-one pieces of maple leaves

To prepare, first boil the wormwood, peach-willow, maple leaves, and scallions with two official sheng of water, reduce to half, strain out the residue, then add the vertex of the head, tiger dung bones, turtle shell, benzoin, and juice from boiling the child's urine. Discard the residue and aim to have about four to five jiao. Grind the areca nut and musk together, mix into a single dose, and take it on an empty stomach in the morning while covered to induce sweating.

If there are fine insects within the sweat, wipe with white paper and throw it into the fire; moments later, they will fall out. If insects are present, burn them in a large fire and dispose of them in running water. The medication used should be kept confidential from the patient. After half a month, when energy and blood levels have returned to normal, repeat the dose according to this method up to three times, stopping if there are no insects. Adjusting diet with nourishing food will allow for recovery. This formula must include half a qian of asafetida.

Another Formula[223p]

　　青松一小握　石榴枝　桃枝　桑枝　柳枝　梅枝各七茎，长四寸　　右用童便一升半，葱白七茎，去头叶，煎及一半，去渣，别入安息香、阿魏各一分，煎至一锺，滤去渣，调辰砂末半钱、槟榔末一分、麝香一字，分作二服调下，五更初一服，五更三点时一服。至巳牌后取下虫，色红者可治，青者不治。见有所下，即进稀粥饮，温暖将息。不可食粉面生冷毒物。合时须择良日，不得令猫犬孝服秽恶妇人见之。[224p]

Take a small handful of green pine, seven branches each of pomegranate, peach, mulberry, willow, and plum, all four inches long. Use one and a half sheng of children's urine on the right, and seven stalks of scallion, removing the tops and leaves. Boil until reduced by half, then strain out the dregs. Add one fen each of benzoin and asafetida, boil until the mixture measures one zhong, then filter out the residue. Mix in half a qian of cinnabar powder, one fen of betel nut powder, and a smidgen of musk, dividing it into two doses. Take one dose at the first hour after dawn and another at three o’clock after dawn. After the si hour, remove the worms; those that are red can be treated, while the green ones cannot. Upon noticing something has been expelled, consume thin porridge and keep warm to rest. Avoid eating raw or cold toxic foods. It is essential to choose an auspicious day, and it is prohibited for cats, dogs, or filthy women to witness this process.[224p]

　　神人阿魏散　治骨蒸传尸等，寒热羸劳，困倦喘嗽。　　阿魏三钱　青蒿一握，研　东北方桃枝一握，切　甘草如病人中指许大，男左女右，细銼　　右以童便二升半，隔夜浸药，明旦煎取一大升，空心温服，分为三服，每次调入槟榔末三分，如人行十里，再进一服。男病女煎，女病男煎。合药时，忌孝子孕妇病人及腥秽鸡犬等物。服后，忌油腻湿面生冷硬物。服一二剂，即吐出虫子，或泻出，更不须服余药。若未吐利，即当尽服。病在上则吐，在下则利，皆出虫如马尾、人发即愈。服药后，觉五脏虚弱，魂魄不安，即以白茯苓汤补之。[225p]

Divine Person Awei San treats bone steaming, transmitted corpses, and related conditions, as well as cold, heat, weakness, fatigue, and cough.

For Awei San, use three qian of Awei, one handful of Qinghao (Hortensia), ground; one handful of northeast peach branches, chopped; and licorice as big as a patient's middle finger, men on the left, women on the right, finely filed.

Soak in two and a half sheng of boy’s urine overnight, then boil to obtain one large sheng of the decoction on the following morning. Take on an empty stomach, divided into three doses, adding three fen of betel nut powder to each dose. If one has walked ten li, take another dose. The male prepares for female illnesses and vice versa. When combining the medicine, avoid using it around filial children, pregnant women, patients, and foul-smelling animals.

After taking, avoid greasy, rich, cold, hard foods. After taking one or two doses, one may expel worms, or have a diarrhea, and need not take any further medicine. If worms are not expelled, one should take the entire dose. If the ailment is above, it will be expelled by vomiting; if below, by diarrhea, with worms appearing like horsehair or human hair, and one will recover.

After taking the medicine, if one feels weakness in the five organs, and unsettled soul and spirit, then replenishing with white poria soup is recommended.[225p]

Bai Fu Ling Decoction

Zhu Sha: 2 qian.

　　新定拯阴理劳汤 【《必读》，下同】 　治阴虚火动，皮寒骨热，食少痰多，咳嗽短气，倦怠焦烦。　　生地黄忌铜铁器，姜汁酒炒透，二钱　归身酒洗　麦冬去心　橘红　丹皮各一钱　莲子不去衣　苡仁各三钱　白芍药酒炒，七分　北五味三分　人参六分　甘草炙，四分　　水二锺，枣一枚，煎一锺，分二次，徐徐呷之。肺脉重按有力者，去人参；有血，加阿胶、童便；热盛，加地骨皮；泄泻，减归、地，加山药、茯苓；倦甚，用参三钱。咳者燥痰也，加贝母、桑皮。嗽者湿痰也，加半夏、茯苓。不寐，加枣仁，汗多亦用。此余自立之方，用治阴虚火炽，譬如溽暑伊郁之时，而商飙飒然倏动，则炎歊如失矣。久服无败胃之虞。[227p]

New Formulation for Treating Yin Deficiency

For symptoms of Yin deficiency with fiery disturbances, cold in the skin and heat in the bones, reduced appetite and excessive phlegm, coughing with shortness of breath, and feelings of fatigue and irritability.

Ingredients:

  • Fresh Rehmannia (Sheng Di Huang), avoid copper or iron utensils.
  • Ginger juice stir-fried in wine, 2 qian.
  • Bai Shao (White Peony) stir-fried in wine, 7 fen.
  • North Five-Flavor Fruit, 3 fen.
  • Ginseng, 6 fen.
  • Licorice, roasted, 4 fen.
  • Lotus seeds, unshelled, 3 qian.
  • Coix seeds, 3 qian.
  • Ophiopogon (Mai Dong) without hearts, 1 qian.
  • Tangerine peel (Ju Hong), 1 qian.
  • Moutan root (Dan Pi), 1 qian.

Combine with 2 bowls of water and 1 jujube, simmer to reduce to 1 bowl, and take in two doses, sipping slowly.

If the lung pulse is strong and firm, omit ginseng; if there is blood present, add donkey-hide gelatin and child's urine; if there is severe heat, add Rehmannia root; for diarrhea, reduce the quantities of Gui and Di, and add yam and Poria; if fatigue is severe, use 3 qian of ginseng.

For dryness-induced coughing, add Fritillaria (Bei Mu) and mulberry bark (Sang Pi). For cough due to damp phlegm, add Pinellia (Ban Xia) and Poria. For insomnia, add jujube seeds; this is also useful in cases of excessive sweating.

This formulation is established for treating severe Yin deficiency with excessive heat, similar to the oppressive heat of midsummer followed by sudden gusts of wind, which disrupts the flow of warmth. Long-term use does not damage the stomach.[227p]

　　新定拯阳理劳汤　治劳伤气耗，倦怠懒言，动则喘乏，表热，自汗心烦，遍身作痛。　　黄芪酒炒，三钱　人参去芦　白朮土炒，各二钱　桂心七分　当归酒炒，一钱半　甘草酒炒，五分　陈皮去白，一钱　北五味打碎，四分　　水二锺，姜三片，枣二枚，煎一锺服。如烦热口干，加生地；气浮心乱，加丹参、枣仁；咳嗽，加麦门冬；挟湿，加茯苓、苍朮；脉沉迟，加熟附子；脉数实，去桂加生地；胸闷，倍陈皮加桔梗；痰多，半夏、茯苓；泄泻，升麻、柴胡；口渴，加干葛。夏月去肉桂，冬月加干姜。[228p]

Newly Compiled Treatment for Labor-Induced Heat Exhaustion

To treat labor injuries, symptoms often include fatigue, lethargy, shortness of breath upon movement, external heat, spontaneous sweating, irritability, and widespread pain.

Ingredients:

  • 9 grams of fried Astragalus
  • 6 grams of ginseng (with the roots removed)
  • 6 grams of fried white Atractylodes
  • 4.5 grams of cinnamon twig
  • 4.5 grams of fried Angelica
  • 2.5 grams of fried licorice
  • 3 grams of dried tangerine peel (white part removed)
  • 1.5 grams of crushed North Five Flavors

Preparation:
Combine with 480 ml of water, 3 slices of ginger, and 2 jujubes; decoct to yield 240 ml and consume.

If symptoms include irritability and dry mouth, add raw Rehmannia.
For heart disturbance and anxiety, add Salvia and jujube seeds.
For coughing, add Ophiopogon.
For dampness, add Poria and Atractylodes.
If the pulse is deep and slow, add prepared Aconite.
If the pulse is rapid and strong, remove cinnamon and add raw Rehmannia.
For chest tightness, double the tangerine peel and add Platycodon.
For excessive phlegm, include Pinellia and Poria.
For diarrhea, add Siberian Silk and Bupleurum.
For thirst, add dried Kudzu.

Remove cinnamon in summer and add dried ginger in winter.[228p]

　　白凤膏 【《良方》，下同】 　治久劳积虚，咳嗽痰血，蒸热困倦。　　黑嘴白鸭一只　大枣二升　参苓平胃散一升　陈煮酒一瓶　　将鸭缚定，量病人饮酒多少，以酒荡温，割开鸭个，滴血入酒饮之，直入肺经受补。将鸭去毛，于肋边开一孔，取去肠杂拭净，次将枣去核，每个中纳参苓散，填满鸭腹中，麻线扎定，沙锅内用火慢煨，将酒三次添入，以干为度。但食其枣，参汤送之，取鸭肉捣丸服。[229p]

Bai Feng Gao
Treats prolonged labor-induced deficiency, cough with phlegm and blood, steaming heat and fatigue.
One black-billed white duck, two sheng of jujubes, one sheng of Ginseng and Poria Powder, one bottle of aged cooked wine.
Secure the duck, measure how much wine the patient can drink, warm the wine, cut open the duck, and let the blood drip into the wine for drinking, directly nourishing the lung meridian. Remove the duck's feathers, make a small opening on its side, remove the entrails and clean it thoroughly. Next, remove the pits from the jujubes, stuff each with the Ginseng and Poria Powder, and fill the duck’s belly, then tie it securely with thread. In a sand pot, simmer slowly over fire, adding the wine three times until adequately dry. Consume only the jujubes and take the ginseng broth with it, then pound the duck meat into pills for ingestion.[229p]

　　芎归血余散　治传尸劳瘵，去鬼杀虫。　　室女顶门生发一小团，皂角汤洗净，酢浸一宿，晒干，纸捻火烧存性　川芎五钱　当归三钱　木香　桃仁去皮尖研，各二钱　安息香　雄黄各一钱　全蝎二枚　江上大鲤鱼生取头，酢炙　　右为末，分四服，每服井水一大碗，净室中煎七分，入红硬降真香末五分，烧北斗符入药。月初五更空心，向北仰天，呪曰：瘵神瘵神，害我生人，吾奉帝勑，服药保身。急急如律令！咒五遍，面北服药毕，南面吸生气入口腹中，烧降香置床下，午时，又如前服药。
　　北斗符式　勑□
　　用黄纸一方，新笔，净水研透明朱砂，书此符。书时，念前北斗咒。[230p]

Xiong Gui Xue Yu San treats the transmission of corpse-related ailments, eliminating ghosts and killing pests. A small tuft of hair is to be taken from the crown of a young woman, cleaned with soapwort decoction, soaked in vinegar for a night, dried, and then burned to retain its essence. Use five coins of Chuanxiong, three coins of Danggui, two coins each of Musk and peeled Tao Ren ground together, one coin each of Benzoin and realgar, and two full scorpions. Take the head of a large carp from the river, treated with vinegar and roasted.

Grind the above into a powder and divide it into four doses. For each dose, boil one large bowl of well water in a clean room until reduced by a third, then mix in five parts of the ground red hard incense, burn the North Dipper talisman into the medicine. On the fifth watch of the month, stand facing north, empty in heart, and recite: "Plague spirit, plague spirit, harming living beings. I serve the Emperor's decree, taking this medicine to protect my body. Quick, quick, as the law commands!" Recite the incantation five times, face north and take the medicine, then face south and inhale the vital energy entering the belly, burn the incense and place it under the bed. At noon, take the medicine again as before.

For the North Dipper talisman, use a piece of yellow paper, a new brush, and clear water to grind transparent cinnabar, writing this talisman while reciting the aforementioned North Dipper incantation.[230p]

　　鳖甲生犀散　杀劳虫，取下恶物。
　　天灵盖一具，男者色不赤可用，女者色赤勿用，檀香煎汤候冷洗。呪曰：电公灵，雷公圣，逢传尸，即须应。急急如律令！咒七遍讫，次用酥炙黄　桃仁去皮炒　安息香　槟榔各五钱　生鳖甲一枚，酢炙　虎长牙二枚，酢炙　生犀角　木香　降真香　甘遂　干漆炒存性　阿魏酒浸研，各三钱　雷丸二钱　穿山甲取趾酢炙　全蝎三个　蚯蚓十条，生研和药　　右为末，每服五钱。先用豉心四十粒，东向桃、李、桑、梅小梢各二茎，长七寸，生蓝青七叶，青蒿一小握，葱白连根洗五茎，石臼内同杵，用井水一碗半，煎取一盏，入童便一盏，内药末，煎取七分，入麝一字，月初旬，五更空心温服，即以被覆取汗。恐汗中有细虫，软帛拭之，即焚其帛。少时必泻，以净桶盛，急钳取虫，烈火焚之，并收入磁瓶中雄黄盖之，以瓦油盏铁线扎定，泥固埋深山中绝人行处。[231p]

The shell of the soft-shelled turtle produces rhinoceros powder to kill pests and remove harmful substances.

A heavenly spirit cap is required; for men, use only if the color is not red; for women, do not use if the color is red. Prepare it by simmering it in sandalwood water until cool, then wash it. The incantation goes: "Lightning Lord spirit, Thunder Lord sacred, wherever a corpse is encountered, you must respond. Urgent as dictated by law!" Recite the incantation seven times, then use the following ingredients: five qian each of fried yellow peach kernels without skin, anise, betel nut, one piece of fresh turtle shell, two pieces of dried tiger incisors, fresh rhinoceros horn, wood fragrance, descending true fragrance, sweet-sorrel, and fried dry lacquer, each three qian; two qian of thunder pills; the toe of a pangolin, fried; three whole scorpions; ten earthworms, ground fresh and mixed with the medicine.

This mix is to be administered in five qian doses. First, use forty grains of fermented soybean heart, position two seven-inch stems of peach, plum, mulberry, and cherry facing east, with seven blue-green leaves growing, a small handful of Qinghao, and five white green onions washed with roots, all ground together in a stone mortar with a bowl and a half of well water to boil down to one cup, add one cup of child's urine, mix in the powdered medicine, boil down to seven parts, then add a word of musk.

On the first month’s early morning, take warm as directed and cover oneself to induce sweating. To be wary of tiny worms in the sweat, wipe it with soft cloth and then burn the cloth. After a while, expect a purge; use a clean bucket to catch the worms quickly, burn them in fierce fire, and collect them in a cinnabar bottle sealed with a yellow cover. Secure the bottle with iron wire and bury it deep in the mountains far from human paths.[231p]

Right Return Decoction: This is a remedy to benefit fire. In cases where the Yang at the life gate is weak and Yin is strong, this formula should be used. Left Return Pill: This treats insufficient true Yin and kidney water, which cannot nourish the Ying and Wei, leading to gradual weakness, possible symptoms of false heat with spontaneous or night sweats, or disconnection of spirit and blood from their origins, or damage to Yin from deficiency, or incontinence of urination, or Qi deficiency causing dizziness, or symptoms like blurred vision, deafness, dry mouth, and dry tongue, or sore waist and weak legs. This formula should be used.

Eight liang of cooked reishi; three liang of Sichuan achyranthes, washed and steamed in wine (do not use glutinous types); crushed tortoise gelatin stir-fried into pearls (optional); crushed deer gelatin stir-fried into pearls; stir-fried Chinese yam; goji berries; mountain dogwood flesh; and prepared Cuscuta seed, each four liang. 　　四阴煎　此保肺清金之剂，治阴虚劳损，相火炽盛，津枯烦渴，咳嗽吐衄多热等证。　　生地二三钱　茯苓一钱半　生甘草一钱　麦冬　白芍药　百合　沙参各二钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食远服。

　　大营煎　治真阴精血亏损，或气血虚寒，心腹疼痛等证。　　当归二三钱或五钱　熟地三五七钱　枸杞　杜仲各二钱　牛膝一钱半　桂　炙草各一二钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

Si Yin Decoction: This is a remedy to protect the lungs and clear the metal element. It treats symptoms like yin deficiency, fatigue, a strong fire of the heart, dryness and thirst, as well as cough, hemoptysis, and heat signs.
Ingredients:

  • 20 grains of Schisandra
  • 1-2 qian each of fried Atractylodes and Licorice
  • 2 bowls of water, add 20 grains of lotus seeds (with hearts removed), decoct and take.

Da Ying Decoction: This treats the loss of true yin essence and blood, or conditions of qi and blood deficiency with cold, abdominal pain, and related symptoms.

  • 2 bowls of water, decoct to 7 parts, to be taken warm and far from meals.

Xiao Ying Decoction: This treats blood deficiency and yin deficiency, and its properties are neutral.

  • 1 qian of fried Licorice
  • 2 bowls of water, decoct to 7 parts, to be taken warm and far from meals.[236p]

Ziánhuà Xuèyú Dān
This medicine greatly replenishes qi and blood.
Xuèyú: Shú Dì steamed and pounded, each 8 taels; Gǒuqǐ; Lùjiǎo jiāo fried pearls; Dāngguī; Tùsīzi processed; Dùzhòng steamed with salt water; Xiǎo huíxiāng slightly fried; Bājī Ròu soaked in wine and peeled, then fried until dry; Fú Líng mixed with milk and steamed; Walnut meat; Héshǒuwū mixed with small black bean juice and steamed seven times. If there are no black beans, use human milk or cow milk for steaming. Cōngróng washed with wine, each 4 taels; Rénshēn in any amount. Take the above, form into honey pills, and swallow with hot white soup, about 2-3 qian before meals.

Jīnshuǐ Liùjūn Jiān
Treats lung and kidney deficiency with cold, causing phlegm.
Shú Dì 3-5 qian; Dāngguī; Bànxià; Fú Líng, each 2 qian; Chénpí 1.5 qian; Zhì gāncǎo 1 qian. Use 2 zhōng of water, and 3-5-7 slices of fresh ginger, decoct to 70-80% and take warm before meals.

Bǎoyīn Jiān
Treats all symptoms of yin deficiency with internal heat and blood movement.
Shēng Dì; Shú Dì; Sháo Yào, each 2 qian; Shānyào; Chuān Xùduàn; Huángqín; Huángbò, each 1.5 qian; Shēng gāncǎo 1 qian. Use 2 zhōng of water, decoct to 70% and take warm before meals.

Sìwèi Huíyáng Yǐn
Treats severe yang deficiency, at risk of imminent collapse.
Rénshēn 1-2 taels; Zhì Fǔzǐ; Pàogānjiāng, each 2-3 qian; Zhì gāncǎo 1-2 qian. Use 2 zhōng of water, boil vigorously to 70-80%, take warm and drink slowly.[237p]

　　温胃饮　治中寒呕吐，吞酸泄泻，不思饮食等证。　　人参一二三钱或一两　白朮炒，一二钱或一两　扁豆炒，二钱　干姜炒焦，一二三钱　炙草一钱　当归一二钱，滑泄者勿用　陈皮一钱或不用　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

Six Flavors Return Yang Decoction: Treats symptoms of impending loss of yin and yang.

  • 1 to 3 qians of fried dried ginger until yellow
  • Optional: 1 to 2 qians of cinnamon
  • 2 jars of water, boil until reduced to 7 or 8 parts, take hot.

  • 2 jars of water, boil until reduced to 7 parts, take warm far from meals.

古今图书集成医部全录卷三百七

虚劳门

　　　　单方

　　百草头上秋露，八月朔日收取，磨墨点膏肓穴，治劳瘵，谓之天灸。 【《外台秘要》，下同】
　　骨蒸发热：雄黄一两，入小便一升，研如粉，乃取黄理石一枚，方圆一尺者，炭火烧之，三食顷，淋浓汁于石上，置薄毡于上，患人脱衣坐之，衣被围住，勿令泄气，三五度瘥。
　　肺劳咳嗽：雌黄一两，入瓦盒内，不固济，坐地上，以土培之，厚二寸，以炭一斤，簇定顶，火煅三分去一，退火出毒为末，糖酥和丸粟米大，每日空心杏仁汤下三丸。【《斗门方》】
　　骨蒸劳病，外寒内热，附骨而蒸也，其根在五脏六腑之中，必因患后得之。骨肉日消，饮食无味，或皮燥而无光，蒸盛之时，四肢渐细，足趺肿起。石膏十两研如乳粉，水和服方寸匕，日再，以身凉为度。【《外台秘要》】[239p]

Hyphenate Huangqi, roasted, cinnamon, ginseng, white atractylodes, angelica, and roasted licorice. Grind and decoct in water to take.

Collection of Books from Ancient and Modern Times, Volume 300, Medical Department

Xulaomen

Single Prescription

The autumn dew atop the hundred herbs is collected on the first day of the eighth month. Grind it and apply it to the acupoint at the heart to treat consumption, called "Heavenly Moxibustion."

For bone steaming and fever: one tael of realgar, mixed in one liter of urine, ground to powder. Then take a piece of Huanglishi about one foot in square shape, burn it over charcoal for a while, and pour the concentrated liquid over the stone. Place a thin mat on top, have the patient sit naked on it, surrounded by clothing to retain heat, and after three to five treatments, they will recover.

For lung consumption and cough: one tael of orpiment placed in a clay box not tightly closed, situated on the ground and surrounded by dirt, about two inches thick. Use one pound of charcoal, tightly packed atop, burn it until one-third is removed. After cooling, it should be ground into powder; mix with sugar and form pills the size of millet. Take three pills daily on an empty stomach with apricot seed decoction.

Bone steaming disease, with external cold and internal heat, manifests as steaming attached to the bones. Its root lies within the five viscera and six bowels and must come after suffering. As bones and flesh gradually waste away, food loses flavor, and the skin becomes dry and lackluster. In times of intense steaming, the limbs gradually thin, and the feet may swell. Grind ten taels of gypsum into powder as fine as milk, mix with water, and take with a small spoon twice daily, while keeping the body cool.[239p]

　　李补阙服乳法：主五劳七伤，咳逆上气。治寒嗽，通音声，明目益精，安五脏，通百节，利九窍，下乳汁，益气补虚损，疗脚弱疼冷，下焦伤竭，强阴。久服延年益寿不老，令人有子。取韶州锺乳，无问厚薄，但颜色明净光泽者，即堪入炼，惟黄赤二色不任用。置于金银器中，大铛着水沉器煮之，令如鱼眼沸，水减即添，乳少三日三夜，乳多七日七夜，候干，色变黄白即熟，如疑生，更煮，满十日最佳。取出去水，更以清水煮半日，其水色清不变即止，乳无毒矣。入瓷钵中，玉槌着水研之，觉干濇即添水，常令如稀米泔状。研至四五日揩之，光腻如书中白鱼，便以水洗之，不随水落者即熟，落者更研。乃澄取暴干，每用一钱半，温酒空服调下，兼和丸散用。其煮乳黄浊水切勿服，服之损人咽喉伤肺，令人头痛或下利不止。其有犯者，但食猪肉解之。【《千金方》】[240p]

Li's method for preparing milk:

This is for treating five labors and seven injuries, coughs, and upward qi. It is effective for treating cold coughs, clarifying the voice, brightening the eyes and enriching essence, calming the five organs, opening the hundred joints, benefiting the nine orifices, promoting lactation, replenishing energy, and healing weaknesses like coldness and pain in the feet. It supports the lower jiao and strengthens the yin. Prolonged use prolongs life, prevents aging, and enhances fertility.

Obtain milk from the Zhao Prefecture, regardless of its thickness, but select only those that are bright, clear, and glossy; avoid yellow and red varieties. Place the milk in a metal vessel; in a large pot with water, boil it until it bubbles like fish eyes, adding water as it decreases. Cook with less milk for three days and nights, and with more for seven days and nights. Wait until it dries and the color changes to yellow-white, and if unsure, cook longer. The best is after ten days.

Remove from water, and boil again in clean water for half a day; stop when the water remains clear and unchanged, indicating the milk is non-toxic. Transfer to a porcelain bowl, and grind with a jade pestle in water, adding water if it feels dry, keeping it in a thin rice gruel-like consistency. Grind for four to five days until it is smooth and shiny like white fish in text, then wash with water; the parts that don’t fall are ready, while those that do need further grinding. After that, dry it completely. Use one and a half qian, mix with warm wine, and take on an empty stomach, also suitable for blending into pills or powders.

Avoid taking the milk if the water is yellow and murky; consumption can harm the throat and injure the lungs, leading to headaches or persistent diarrhea. If one succumbs, eating pork can counteract the effects. 【From "Qianjinfang"】[240p]

　　锺乳煎：治风虚劳损，腰脚无力，补益强壮。用锺乳粉炼成者三两，以夹练袋盛之，牛乳一大升，煎减三之一，去袋饮乳，分二服，日一作。不吐不利，虚冷人微溏无苦。一袋可煮三十度，即力尽，别作袋。每煎讫，酒濯净令通气，其滓和面，喂鸡，生子食之。此崔尚书方也。【《千金翼》，下同】
　　补益劳损：用白石英末三斤，和黑豆，与十岁以上生犊(牛孛)牛食，每日与一两，七日取牛乳，或热服一升，或作粥食。其粪种菜食。百无所忌。润脏腑，泽肌肉，令人壮健。
　　一切劳嗽胸膈痞满：焚香透膈散，用鹅管石、雄黄、佛耳草、(艹款)冬花等分为末，每用一钱，安香炉上焚之，以筒吸烟入喉中，日二次。 【《宣明方》】[241p]

Zhongru Jian: This treats wind deficiency, labor damage, and weakness in waist and legs, helping to replenish and strengthen. Take three taels of pulverized Zhongru, packed in a cloth bag. Use one large sheng of cow's milk, simmer down to one-third, remove the bag and drink the milk, dividing into two doses per day. If there is no vomiting or urgency, it is suitable for individuals with a weak and cold constitution who have slight diarrhea without discomfort. One bag can be boiled thirty times, once exhausted, prepare another bag. After each decoction, cleanse it with wine to ensure ventilation. The residue can be mixed with flour to feed chickens or can be consumed by pregnant women. This is a formula by Minister Cui.

For replenishing and healing from damage: Use three jin of white quartz powder combined with black beans, and feed it to calves that are ten years old or younger, giving one tael per day. After seven days, obtain the cow's milk; it can be taken hot (one sheng), or made into porridge. The manure can be used for growing vegetables. There are no restrictions on its use. It moistens internal organs and nourishes muscles, encouraging strength and health.

For all forms of cough and chest fullness: Use a fragrant smoke to disperse through the diaphragm. Burn a mix of goose tube stone, realgar, and Buddha's ear herb, grinding them to a powder in equal parts. Use one qian each time and set it in an incense burner to burn, inhaling the smoke through a tube into the throat, twice daily.[241p]

　　元气虚寒，精滑不禁，大肠溏泄，手足厥冷：阳起石煅研，锺乳粉各等分，酒煮附子末，同面糊丸梧子大，每空心米饮服五十九，以愈为度。【《济生方》】
　　虚劳骨蒸热病：芒硝研末，水服方寸匕，日二，神良。 【《千金方》】
　　劳瘵有虫：硼砂、硇砂、兔屎等分为末，蜜丸梧子大，每服七丸，生甘草一分，新水一锺，揉汁送下。自朔至望，五更时，令病人勿言服之。【《乾坤秘韫》】
　　男子妇人诸虚不足，烦悸焦渴，面色萎黄，不能饮食，或先渴而后发疮疖，或先痈疽而后发渴，并宜常服此药，平补气血，安和脏腑，终身可免痈疽之疾。用绵黄芪箭簳者，去芦六两，一半生焙，一半以盐水润湿，饭上蒸三次，焙銼粉；甘草一两，一半生用，一半炙黄为末。每服二钱，白汤点服。早晨日午各一服，亦可煎服。名黄芪六一汤。【《外科精要》】[242p]

The original text discusses various Traditional Chinese Medicine remedies for different ailments. Here’s the translated English text:

For deficiency of vital energy leading to coldness, uncontrollable slippery essence, diarrhea of the large intestine, and cold limbs: grind stone from Yangqi and equal parts of gelatinous milk powder, cook powdered Aconite in wine, mix with flour to form pills the size of a walnut; take five to nine pills with hollow rice water until recovery is achieved.

For deficiency and hot illnesses caused by overwork: grind salt into powder, take a small spoonful with water, twice a day, to achieve spiritual goodness.

For exhaustion with parasitic conditions: mix borax, nitre, and rabbit droppings into a fine powder, mold into pills the size of a walnut; take seven pills with one section of fresh licorice and new water, knead to extract juice for consumption. From the first to the full moon, instruct the patient not to speak while taking it at dawn.

For men and women with deficiencies leading to unrest, anxiety, dryness and thirst, yellow pallor of the face, inability to eat or drink, or experience thirst before developing sores, or develop boils before feeling thirst, it is advisable to take this medicine regularly to tonify qi and blood, stabilize and harmonize the internal organs, ensuring lifelong immunity from boils and sores. Use six taels of fine yellow astragalus, removing the reeds; half should be raw and half roasted with saltwater, steaming with rice three times, then grind into powder; one tael of licorice, half raw and half roasted until golden, ground into powder. Take two coins each time, mixed with clear broth for consumption. One dose in the morning and another at noon, or it can also be decocted. This is called Huangqi Liu Yi Decoction.[242p]

　　脾胃虚弱，不思饮食：生姜半斤取汁，白蜜十两，人参末四两，银锅煎成膏，每米饮调服一匙。【《普济方》】
　　阳虚气喘，自汗盗汗，气短头运：人参五钱，熟附子一两，分作四帖，每帖以生姜十片，流水二盏，煎一盏，食远温服。【《济生方》】
　　补益劳伤精败面黑：用苁蓉四两，水煮令烂，细切，研精羊肉分为四度，下五味，以米煮粥，空心食。【《药性论》】
　　参朮膏：治一切脾胃虚损，益元气。白朮一斤，人参四两，切片，以流水十五碗，浸一夜，桑柴文武火煎，取浓汁熬膏，入炼蜜收之，每以白汤点服。【《集简方》】
　　腹中虚冷，不能饮食，食辄不消，羸弱生病：朮二斤，曲一斤，炒为末，蜜丸梧子大，每服三十丸，米汤下，日三服。大冷加干姜三两，腹痛加当归三两，羸弱加甘草二两。【《肘后方》】
　　骨节积热，渐渐黄瘦：黄连四分切，以童子小便五大合浸经宿，微煎三四沸，去滓，分作二服。【《广利方》】[243p]

  • Weakness of the spleen and stomach, lack of appetite: Take half a pound of fresh ginger juice, ten taels of white honey, and four taels of powdered ginseng. Boil in a silver pot until it becomes a paste, and mix one spoonful with rice wine to take.

  • Yang deficiency with asthma, spontaneous sweating, night sweats, shortness of breath, and dizziness: Use five qian of ginseng and one tael of cooked prepared aconite, divided into four doses. For each dose, add ten slices of fresh ginger and two cups of water, boil down to one cup, and take warm away from meals.

  • To replenish and benefit from overexertion, weak essence, and dark complexion: Use four taels of cistanche, boil in water until soft, finely chop, and grind into a paste with lamb meat divided into four portions. Add five flavors, and cook with rice to make porridge to eat on an empty stomach.

  • Ginseng and Atractylodes paste: Treats all cases of spleen and stomach deficiency, benefiting original qi. Use one pound of Atractylodes and four taels of ginseng, slice and soak in fifteen bowls of running water overnight. Boil with gentle fire until concentrated, then mix with refined honey and store it. Take with warm water.

  • Coldness in the stomach, inability to eat, food not digesting, weakness, and illness: Use two pounds of Atractylodes and one pound of starter yeast, fry to a fine powder, mix with honey to form walnut-sized pills. Take thirty pills with rice soup, three times a day. For severe cold, add three taels of dry ginger; for abdominal pain, add three taels of angelica; for weakness, add two taels of licorice.

  • Accumulation of heat in the joints, gradually becoming yellow and thin: Take four fen of Coptis, cut it and soak in a child's urine in five large cups overnight. Slightly boil three to four times, then strain and divide into two doses.[243p]

　　虚劳发热：柴胡、人参等分，每服三钱，姜枣同水煎服。 【《澹寮方》】
　　劳瘵熏法：甘松六两、元参一斤为末，每日焚之。 【《良方》】
　　胃弱呕逆不食：用草豆蔻仁二枚，高良姜半两，水一盏，煮取汁，入生姜汁半合，和白面作拨刀，以羊肉臛汁煮熟，空心食之。【《普济方》】
　　男女五劳七伤，下元久冷，一切风病，四肢疼痛，驻颜壮气，乌髭须：补骨脂一斤，酒浸一宿，晒干，却用乌油麻一升和炒，令麻子声绝簸去，只取补骨脂为末，酢煮面糊丸如梧子大，每服二三十丸，空心温酒盐汤任下。【《经验方》】
　　冷劳久病：茅香花、艾叶四两，烧存性研末，粟米饭丸梧子大，初以蛇床子汤，下二十丸至三十丸，微吐不妨。后用枣汤下，立效。【《圣济总录》】
　　男妇劳瘦：青蒿细銼，水三升，童子小便五升，同煎取一升，去滓入器中煎成膏，丸如梧子大，每空心及卧时，温酒吞下二十丸。【《斗门方》】[244p]

  • For虚劳发热: Mix equal parts of Chai Hu and Ren Shen, take three qian each time, and boil with ginger and jujube in water for consumption.

　　虚劳寒热，肢体倦疼，不拘男妇：八九月青蒿成实时采之，去枝梗，以童子小便浸三日，晒干为末，每服二钱，乌梅一个，煎汤服。【《灵苑方》】
　　骨蒸鬼气：童子小便五大斗澄清，青蒿五斗，八九月拣带子者最好，细銼相和，纳大釜中，以猛火煎取三大斗，去滓溉釜令净，再以微火煎可二大斗，入猪胆一枚，同煎一大斗半，去火待冷，以瓷器盛之。每欲服时，取甘草二三两炙熟为末，以煎和捣千杵为丸，空腹粥饮下二十丸，渐增至三十丸止。【《海上方》】
　　骨蒸烦热：青蒿一握，猪胆汁一枚，杏仁四十个，去皮尖炒，以童子小便一大盏，煎五分，空心温服。【《十便良方》】
　　男女虚损，或大病后，或积劳后，四体沉滞，骨肉酸痛，呼吸少气，或小腹拘急，腰背强痛，咽干唇燥，或饮食无味，多卧少起，久者积年，轻者百日，渐至瘦削：用生地黄二斤，面一斤，捣烂炒干为末，每空心酒服方寸匕，日三服。忌如法。【《肘后方》】[245p]

Here is the translation of the provided Classical Chinese text into English:

For symptoms of weakness from cold and heat, with fatigue and pain in the limbs, regardless of whether male or female: in August and September, when mugwort is ripe, collect it, remove the stems, and soak it in the urine of a young boy for three days. After drying, grind it into powder. Take two qian (a unit of weight) with one black plum, and prepare it as a decoction to drink.

For "bone steaming" and ghostly qi: use five large dou (a unit of measure) of clarified urine from a young boy, and five dou of mugwort, selecting the ones with stems in August and September for the best quality. Finely grind and mix, then place in a large pot and simmer over a fierce fire to extract three dou. Remove the dregs and clean the pot, then simmer again with a gentle fire until it yields two dou. Add one pig’s gallbladder and simmer together for one and a half dou. Turn off the heat and let it cool, then store it in a porcelain vessel. When ready to take, prepare two to three liang (another weight measurement) of roasted licorice into powder, mix it, and grind it into pills. Take twenty pills on an empty stomach with porridge, gradually increasing to thirty pills.

For "bone steaming" and heat discomfort: use a handful of mugwort, one gallbladder of a pig, and forty apricot kernels, removing the skins and frying them. Use one large cup of urine from a young boy, decoct for five minutes and take it warm on an empty stomach.

For both men and women with deficiency, either after a serious illness or prolonged strain, with general heaviness, aches in bones and muscles, shortness of breath, or constriction in the lower abdomen, strong pain in the lower back, dry throat, and chapped lips, or loss of appetite, excessive lying down with little movement, which may last for years or as short as a hundred days leading to gradual emaciation: take two jin (a measure of weight) of fresh rehmannia and one jin of flour, crush and dry it into powder. Take a small spoonful on an empty stomach with alcohol, three times a day. Avoid following the same method.

　　虚劳困乏：地黄一石，取汁，酒三斗搅匀，煎膏服。 【《必效方》】
　　骨蒸劳热，张文仲方：用生地一升，捣三度，绞尽，分再服。若利即减之，以凉为度。【《外台秘要》】

  1. For exhaustion and fatigue: Take one stone of Rehmannia, extract the juice, mix with three dou of wine, and simmer to form a paste for consumption.

　　虚劳不眠：干姜为末，汤服三钱，取微汗出。 【《千金方》】

　　传尸劳疰，最杀劳虫：用真川椒红色者去子及合口，以黄草纸二重隔之，炒出汗，取放地上，以砂盆盖定，以火灰密遮四旁，约一时许，为细末去壳，以老酒浸，白糕和丸梧子大，每服四十丸，食前盐汤下，服至一斤，其疾自愈。【《三因方》】

　　脾劳发热，有虫在脾中为病，令人好呕者：东行茱萸根大者一尺，大春子八升，橘皮二两，三物(口父)咀，以酒一斗，浸一宿，微火薄暖之，绞去渣。平旦空腹服一升，取虫下，或死，或半烂，或下黄汁。凡作药时，切忌言语。 【《删繁方》】[249p]

To treat exhaustion and fatigue caused by labor, which most severely affects the labor dampness, use red Sichuan pepper. Remove the seeds and combine it with yellow paper in two layers as a barrier. Stir-fry until sweating occurs, then place it on the ground and cover with a sand pot tightly, shading it with ash all around for about an hour. Once done, grind it into a fine powder, remove the husk, and soak in aged wine. Form it into balls the size of a walnut, taking forty balls each time with salty broth before meals, until you have consumed a pound, and the ailment will heal itself.

For bone fever: take one hundred and twenty peach kernels, leaving the tips, and remove the skin and double kernels. Grind into a paste and take with spring water in the morning, then drink alcohol until intoxicated and eat freely. Administer once every two days, and refrain from eating meat for a hundred days.

For those with weak spleen and stomach, who feel chest pressure and are unable to eat or drink: grind Red Pepper fruit into a powder, mix with ginger juice to form walnut-sized balls, taking seventy balls with ginger soup twice daily.

For spleen fatigue causing fever, with worms in the spleen leading to nausea: use a large root of Zhuyu about one foot long, eight sheng of big spring seeds, and two liang of orange peel. Crush all three slightly, soak in one dou of wine for a night, warm gently over a low fire, and then strain out the pulp. Take one sheng on an empty stomach in the morning; this will expel the worms, which may die, partially rot, or discharge yellow fluid. When preparing this medicine, it is essential to avoid speaking.[249p]

　　补虚益损：水芝丹。用莲实半升，酒浸二宿，以牙猪肚一个，洗净，入莲在内，缝定，煮熟取出，晒干为末，煮米糊丸梧子大，每服五十丸，食前温酒送下。【《医学发明》】
　　补益虚弱：用乌雄鸡一只，治净，五味煮极烂，食。生即反损人。或五味腌炙食，亦良。
　　男女因积虚或大病后，虚损沉困，酸疼盗汗，少气喘惙，或小腹拘急，心悸胃弱，多卧少起，渐至瘦削，若年深五脏气竭，难治也。用乌雌鸡一头，治如食法，以生地黄一斤切，饴糖一升纳腹内，缚定，铜器贮，于瓶中蒸五升米，熟取出，食肉饮汁，勿用盐，一月一作，神效。【姚生坦方】

Both men and women may suffer from accumulated weakness or after serious illness, leading to deficiency and fatigue, accompanied by muscle aches, night sweats, short breaths, or a tense lower abdomen, palpitations, weak stomach, excessive lying down, and gradual emaciation. If this persists into old age and the body's vital energy is exhausted, it becomes hard to treat. Secure and store in a copper container, steam with five sheng of rice until cooked, eat the meat and drink the broth, avoiding salt, once a month for miraculous effects.

　　虚劳瘵疾：乌鸦一只绞死，去毛肠，入人参片、花椒各五钱，缝合水煮熟食，以汤下。鸦骨参椒焙研，枣肉丸服。【《食疗》】
　　心气虚损：猪腰子一枚，水二碗　煮至一碗半，切碎，入人参、当归各半两，煮至八分，吃腰子，以汁送下。未尽者，同滓作丸服。【《百一选方》】
　　传尸劳瘵：猪腰子一对，童子小便二盏，无灰酒一盏，新瓷瓶盛之，泥封炭火温养，自戌至子时止，待五更初温熟取开，饮酒食腰子，病笃者只一月效。平日瘦怯者，亦可用之。盖以血养血，绝胜金石草木之药也。【《经验方》】
　　补益虚羸：用猪肚一具，入人参五两，蜀椒一两，葱白七个，粳米半升在内，密缝煮熟食。【《千金翼》，下同】
　　补益虚寒：精羊肉一斤，碎白石英三两，以肉包之，外用荷叶裹定，于一石米中蒸熟，取石英和葱姜作小馄饨子，每日空腹，以冷浆水吞一百枚，甚补益。[251p]

For虚劳瘵疾 (consumption-related illnesses): Take one crow, strangle it, remove its feathers and entrails, and add five qian each of ginseng and Sichuan pepper. Sew it up and boil until cooked. Consume the broth. Also, dry the crow's bones with ginseng and Sichuan pepper, grind them, and take them in jujube paste balls.

For心气虚损 (deficiency of heart energy): Use one pig's kidney and two bowls of water, boil down to one and a half bowls. Chop it up, add half a liang each of ginseng and angelica root, and boil down to eight-tenths. Eat the kidney and drink the juice. If there’s any left, mix it with the residue and form into balls to take.

For传尸劳瘵 (transmitted consumption-related illnesses): Take a pair of pig kidneys, two bowls of a boy's urine, one bowl of clean wine, and hold them in a new ceramic bottle, sealing with clay and warming over charcoal from the evening till midnight. At dawn, open it and drink the wine and eat the kidneys. For those seriously ill, it can work in just a month. Those who are usually thin and frail can also benefit. This is because blood nourishes blood, which surpasses metals, stones, plants, and herbs.

For补益虚羸 (nourishing the weak): Use one pig’s stomach, add five liang of ginseng, one liang of Sichuan pepper, seven green onions, and half a sheng of glutinous rice inside. Sew it up tight and cook until done.

For补益虚寒 (nourishing deficiency in cold): Take one pound of lean lamb meat, and three liang of crushed quartz. Wrap the meat in the quartz, encase it with lotus leaves, and steam it in one stone of rice until cooked. Take the quartz and mix it with green onions and ginger to make small wontons. Eat one hundred pieces daily on an empty stomach with cold water, which is extremely nourishing.[251p]

　　骨蒸久冷：羊肉一斤，山药一斤，各烂煮，研如泥，下米煮粥食之。 【《饮膳正要》】
　　骨蒸传尸：用羊肉一拳大煮熟，皂荚一尺炙，以无灰酒一升，铜铛内煮三五沸，去滓，入黑锡一两，令病人先啜肉汁，乃服一合，当吐虫如马尾为效。【《外台秘要》】
　　五劳七伤：白羊头蹄一具净治，更以稻草烧烟，熏令黄色，水煮半熟，纳胡椒、荜茇、干姜各一两，葱、豉各一升，再煮去药，日食一具，七日即愈。【《千金方》，下同】
　　虚劳口干：《千金》用羊脂一鸡子大，醇酒半升，枣七枚，渍七日，食立愈。《外台》用羊脂鸡子大，纳半斤酢中一宿，绞汁含之。
　　五劳七伤，阳虚无力：经验用羊肾一对，去脂切，肉苁蓉一两，酒浸一夕，去皮和作羹，下葱盐五味食。【《经验方》】
　　阳气衰败，腰脚疼痛，五劳七伤：用羊肾三对，羊肉半斤，葱白一茎，枸杞叶一斤，同五味煮成汁，下米作粥、食之。【《正要》】[252p]

  • For bone steaming from long-term cold: One pound of mutton and one pound of yam, cook until soft, mash into a paste, then boil with rice to make porridge for consumption.

  • For bone steaming with corpse: Use a chunk of mutton the size of a fist, cook until done, roast one foot of soap pod, add one liter of pure wine, boil in a copper pot for three to five minutes, remove dregs, add one tael of black tin, have the patient sip the meat broth, then take one dose to expel worms like horsehair.

  • For the five labors and seven injuries: Clean one complete sheep's head and hooves, burn rice straw to produce smoke until yellow, boil in water until half-cooked, add one tael each of pepper, prickly ash, and dried ginger, and one liter each of scallion and fermented soybeans, boil again to remove the medications, eat one whole piece daily, and recover in seven days.

  • For exhaustion and dry mouth: The "Thousand Golden" prescription uses one egg-sized portion of sheep tallow, half a liter of strong wine, and seven dates soaked for seven days; eating this cures immediately. The "External Platform" recipe uses egg-sized sheep tallow soaked overnight in half a pound of vinegar, squeeze the juice and hold it in the mouth.

  • For the five labors and seven injuries with yang deficiency and weakness: Traditional experience uses one pair of sheep kidneys, remove fat and cut; one tael of raw Cistanche; soak in wine overnight, remove the skin, and prepare a soup, adding scallions, salt, and five spices for consumption.

  • For weakened yang energy, painful waist and legs, and the five labors and seven injuries: Use three pairs of sheep kidneys, half a pound of mutton, one stalk of scallion, and one pound of goji leaves, boil together with five spices to extract the juice, then cook rice to make porridge and consume.[252p]

　　虚损劳伤：羊肾一枚，米一升，水一斗，煮九升服，日三。 【《肘后方》】
　　久病虚羸，不生肌肉，水气在胁下，不能饮食，四肢烦热者：用羊肾一枚，白朮一升切，水二斗，煮九升，分九服，日三，不过三剂瘥。【张文仲方】
　　老人虚弱：白羊脊骨一具，銼碎，水煮取汁，枸杞根銼一斗，水五斗煮汁一斗五升，合汁同骨煮至五升，去骨瓷盒盛之，每以二合和温酒一盏调服。【《多能鄙事》】
　　虚劳瘦弱：用羊胫骨四十枚，以水一升，熬减大半，去滓及油，待凝任食。 【《正要》】
　　骨蒸发热：多取诸朽骨洗净，上气釜煮，入桃柳枝各五斗，煮枯再入棘针三斗，煮减半去滓，以酢浆水和之，煮三五沸，令患者正坐散发，以汤从顶淋之，惟热为佳。若心闷可少进冷粥，当得大汗，出恶气，汗干乃粉身食豉粥。【《拾遗》】[253p]

Deficiency and Exhaustion from Labor: One sheep kidney, one sheng of rice, one dou of water, boil down to nine sheng and take three times a day.

Prolonged Illness and Weakness: For those with long-term illness who are emaciated, not gaining muscle, suffering from water retention beneath the ribs, unable to eat or drink, with hot limbs: use one sheep kidney, one sheng of Atractylodes sliced, two dou of water, boil down to nine sheng, divide into nine doses, take three times a day. No more than three doses will lead to recovery.

Weakness in the Elderly: One whole sheep spine, crushed, extract juice by boiling with one dou of goji root, using five dou of water to yield one sheng and five liters of juice. Combine the juice with the bone, boil down to five sheng, strain and store in a porcelain jar, each time mix two he of the mixture with a warm cup of wine to take.

Deficiency and Thinness: Use forty sheep leg bones, with one sheng of water, reduce to half through boiling, discard the residue and oil, wait until it solidifies and then consume.

Bone Steaming and Heat: Collect various decayed bones, wash clean, boil in a cauldron, add five dou of peach and willow branches, boil until dried, then add three dou of spiny thorns, boil down by half and strain. Mix with vinegar and water, boil three to five times, have the patient sit upright and let the decoction pour from above. It is best when hot. If experiencing heart discomfort, a small amount of cold porridge can be consumed, leading to plenty of sweating, expelling bad Qi. Once sweating has ceased, consume powdered food with fermented soy porridge.[253p]

　　五劳七伤：用干漆、柏子仁、山茱萸、酸枣仁各等分为末，蜜丸梧子大，每服二七丸，温酒下，日二服。【《千金方》】
　　卒热劳疾：皂荚续成一尺，以土酥一大两，微涂缓炙，酥尽捣筛，蜜丸梧子大，每日空腹饮下十五丸，渐增至二十丸，重者不过两剂愈。【《海上方》】
　　急劳烦热体瘦：三皂丸。用皂荚、皂荚树皮、皂荚刺各一斤，同烧灰，以水三斗淋汁，再淋，如此三五度，煎之，候少凝，入麝香末一分，以童子小便浸，蒸饼丸小豆大，每空心温水下七丸。【《圣惠方》】
　　脾胃虚弱，不思饮食，食下不化，病似翻胃噎膈：清明日，取柳枝一大把熬汤，煮小米作饭，洒面滚成珠子，晒干，袋悬风处，每用滚水随意下米，米沉住火少时，米浮取看，无硬心则熟，可顿食之。久则面散不粘矣。名曰络索米。【《简便方》】[254p]

Five Labors and Seven Injuries: Grind equal parts of dried lacquer, cedar seeds, cornelian cherries, and sour jujube seeds into powder. Form into honey pills the size of a walnut. Take two to seven pills with warm wine, twice daily. [From "Qianjin Fang"]

Acute Heat Labor Ailment: Take a foot-long piece of soap pod. Use a large quantity of soil grease to lightly coat and gently roast it. Grind into powder after the grease is fully absorbed, then sift. Acute Labor Heat with Weight Loss: Prepare three soap pills using soap pods, soap pod bark, and soap pod thorns, each one pound. Burn to ash, and with three buckets of water, wash out the juice, repeating three to five times. Boil until it thickens slightly, then add one part musk powder, soaked in a young boy's urine. Form into small bean-sized pills. Take seven pills with warm water on an empty stomach. [From "Shenghui Fang"]

Weak Spleen and Stomach, Lack of Appetite, Indigestion: On a clear day, take a large handful of willow branches to decoct as soup. Cook millet to make rice, sprinkle with flour to form pearls, and let dry in the wind. Use boiling water to steep as desired. When the rice sinks, reduce the heat; when it floats, check for doneness; if there are no hard centers, it is ready to eat. Over time, the flour will no longer stick. This is called "Luosuo Rice." [From "Jianbian Fang"][254p]

　　胆虚不眠，心多惊悸：用酸枣仁一两，炒香捣为散，每服二钱，竹叶汤调下。《和剂局方》加人参一两、辰砂半两、乳香二钱半，炼蜜丸服。
　　虚损百病，久服发白再黑，返老还童：用女贞实十月上巳日收，阴干，用时以酒浸一日，蒸透晒干一斤四两；旱莲草五月收，阴干十两为末；桑葚子三月收，阴干十两为末。炼蜜丸如梧子大，每服七八十丸，淡盐汤下。若四月收桑葚捣汁和药，七月收旱莲捣汁和药，即不用蜜矣。【《简便方》】
　　骨蒸不眠心烦：用酸枣仁一两，水二盏，研绞取汁，下粳米二合煮粥，候熟，下地黄汁一合再煮匀食。【《圣惠方》】
　　虚劳不足：五加皮、枸杞根白皮各一斗，水一石五斗，煮汁七斗，分取四斗，浸曲一斗，以三斗拌饭，如常酿酒法，待熟任饮。【《千金方》，下同】[255p]

If there is gall deficiency causing insomnia and frequent heart palpitations, take one tael of sour jujube seeds, fry them until fragrant and then grind them into a powder. For deficiency causing various ailments, long-term use can turn gray hair back to black, rejuvenating the body. Use the fruit of the jujube picked on the tenth day of the month in spring, dry it in the shade, soak in wine for one day when needed, steam and sun-dry to yield one and four taels; collect dried land lotus grass in May to make ten taels of powder; collect mulberry seeds in March to make ten taels of powder. Form pills the size of jujube seeds, taking seventy to eighty pills with a light saline decoction. If mulberries are collected in April, juiced and mixed with the medicine, or land lotus is collected in July, juiced and mixed with the medicine, honey is not needed.

　　骨虚劳极，面肿垢黑，脊痛不能久立，血气衰惫，发落齿枯，甚则喜唾：用鹿角二两，牛膝酒浸焙一两半为末，炼蜜丸梧子大，每服五十丸，空心盐酒下。【《济生方》】
